property.name: registry
property.description: A list of widgets on a page.

property.name: dijit
property.description: A roll-up for common dijit methods

method.name: showTooltip
method.description: Display tooltip w/specified contents in specified position. See description of dijit.Tooltip.defaultPosition for details on position parameter. If position is not specified then dijit.Tooltip.defaultPosition is used.

method.name: hideTooltip
method.description: hide the tooltip

method.name: isCollapsed
method.description: tests whether the current selection is empty

method.name: getBookmark
method.description: Retrieves a bookmark that can be used with moveToBookmark to return to the same range

method.name: moveToBookmark
method.description: Moves current selection to a bookmark

parameter.name: bookmark
parameter.description: This should be a returned object from dojo.html.selection.getBookmark()

method.name: getFocus
method.description: Returns the current focus and selection. Called when a popup appears (either a top level menu or a dialog), or when a toolbar/menubar receives focus
method.return-description: A handle to restore focus/selection

parameter.name: menu
parameter.description: The menu that's being opened

parameter.name: openedForWindow
parameter.description: iframe in which menu was opened

method.name: focus
method.description: Sets the focused node and the selection according to argument. To set focus to an iframe's content, pass in the iframe itself.

parameter.name: handle
parameter.description: object returned by get(), or a DomNode

method.name: registerWin
method.description: Registers listeners on the specified window (either the main window or an iframe) to detect when the user has clicked somewhere. Anyone that creates an iframe should call this function.

method.name: _onBlurNode
method.description: Called when focus leaves a node. Usually ignored, _unless_ it *isn't* follwed by touching another node, which indicates that we tabbed off the last field on the page, in which case every widget is marked inactive

method.name: _onTouchNode
method.description: Callback when node is focused or mouse-downed

method.name: byId
method.description: Returns a widget by its id, or if passed a widget, no-op (like dojo.byId())

method.name: byNode
method.description: Returns the widget as referenced by node

method.name: getEnclosingWidget
method.description: Returns the widget whose dom tree contains node or null if the node is not contained within the dom tree of any widget

method.name: isTabNavigable
method.description: Tests if an element is tab-navigable

method.name: _getTabNavigable
method.description: Finds the following descendants of the specified root node: * the first tab-navigable element in document order without a tabindex or with tabindex="0" * the last tab-navigable element in document order without a tabindex or with tabindex="0" * the first element in document order with the lowest positive tabindex value * the last element in document order with the highest positive tabindex value

method.name: getFirstInTabbingOrder
method.description: Finds the descendant of the specified root node that is first in the tabbing order

method.name: getLastInTabbingOrder
method.description: Finds the descendant of the specified root node that is last in the tabbing order

method.name: placeOnScreen
method.description: Positions one of the node's corners at specified position such that node is fully visible in viewport.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: Object like {x: 10, y: 20}

parameter.name: corners
parameter.description: Array of Strings representing order to try corners in, like ["TR", "BL"]. Possible values are: * "BL" - bottom left * "BR" - bottom right * "TL" - top left * "TR" - top right

method.example: Try to place node's top right corner at (10,20). If that makes node go (partially) off screen, then try placing bottom left corner at (10,20). placeOnScreen(node, {x: 10, y: 20}, ["TR", "BL"])

method.name: _place
method.description: Given a list of spots to put node, put it at the first spot where it fits, of if it doesn't fit anywhere then the place with the least overflow

parameter.name: choices
parameter.description: of elements like: {corner: 'TL', pos: {x: 10, y: 20} } Above example says to put the top-left corner of the node at (10,20)

parameter.name: layoutNode

method.name: hasWaiRole
method.description: Determines if an element has a particular non-XHTML role.

method.name: getWaiRole
method.description: Gets the non-XHTML role for an element (which should be a wai role).
method.return-description: The non-XHTML role of elem or an empty string if elem does not have a role.

method.name: setWaiRole
method.description: Sets the role on an element.

method.name: removeWaiRole
method.description: Removes the specified non-XHTML role from an element. removes role attribute if no specific role provided (for backwards compat.)

method.name: hasWaiState
method.description: Determines if an element has a given state.
method.return-description: true if elem has a value for the given state and false if it does not.

method.name: getWaiState
method.description: Gets the value of a state on an element.
method.return-description: The value of the requested state on elem or an empty string if elem has no value for state.

method.name: setWaiState
method.description: Sets a state on an element.

method.name: removeWaiState
method.description: Removes a state from an element.

method.name: getDocumentWindow
method.description: Get window object associated with document doc

method.name: selectInputText
method.description: Select text in the input element argument, from start (default 0), to stop (default end).

object.description: A keyboard accessible color-picking widget

property.name: defaultTimeout
property.description: number of milliseconds before a held key or button becomes typematic

property.name: timeoutChangeRate
property.description: fraction of time used to change the typematic timer between events 1.0 means that each typematic event fires at defaultTimeout intervals < 1.0 means that each typematic event fires at an increasing faster rate

property.name: palette
property.description: Size of grid, either "7x10" or "3x4".

property.name: _currentFocus
property.description: Index of the currently focused color.

property.name: _xDim
property.description: This is the number of colors horizontally across.

property.name: _yDim
property.description: / This is the number of colors vertically down.

property.name: templatePath
property.description: Path to the template of this widget.

property.name: tabIndex
property.description: Widget tabindex.

method.name: focus
method.description: Focus this ColorPalette. Puts focus on the first swatch.

method.name: onChange
method.description: Callback when a color is selected.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: Hex value corresponding to color. console.debug("Color selected is: "+color);

method.name: _onCellDijitclick
method.description: Handler for click, enter key & space key. Selects the color.

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: The event.

method.name: _onCellMouseEnter
method.description: Handler for onMouseOver. Put focus on the color under the mouse.

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: The mouse event.

method.name: _onCellFocus
method.description: Handler for onFocus. Removes highlight of the color that just lost focus, and highlights the new color.

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: The focus event.

method.name: _setCurrent
method.description: Called when color is hovered or focused.

method.name: _onCellBlur
method.description: needed for Firefox 2 on Mac OS X

method.name: _selectColor
method.description: This selects a color. It triggers the onChange event area: The area node that covers the color being selected.

method.name: _navigateByKey
method.description: This is the callback for typematic. It changes the focus and the highlighed color.

parameter.name: increment
parameter.description: much the key is navigated.

parameter.name: typeCount
parameter.description: many times typematic has fired.

object.description: This represents the value of the colors. The first level is a hashmap of the different arrays available The next two dimensions represent the columns and rows of colors.
This is stores the path to the palette images
This is a map that is used to calculate the coordinates of the images that make up the palette.
Size of the supported palettes for alignment purposes.
The Declaration widget allows a user to declare new widget classes directly from a snippet of markup.

The component that grays out the screen behind the dialog Template has two divs; outer div is used for fade-in/fade-out, and also to hold background iframe. Inner div has opacity specified in CSS file.

method.name: postCreate
method.description: Append the underlay to the body

method.name: layout
method.description: Sets the background to the size of the viewport

method.name: show
method.description: Show the dialog underlay

method.name: hide
method.description: hides the dialog underlay

method.name: execute
method.description: User defined function to do stuff when the user hits the submit button

method.name: onCancel
method.description: Callback when user has canceled dialog, to notify container (user shouldn't override)

method.name: onExecute
method.description: Callback when user is about to execute dialog, to notify container (user shouldn't override)

method.name: _onSubmit
method.description: callback when user hits submit button

object.description: A modal dialog Widget

property.name: open
property.description: is True or False depending on state of dialog

property.name: duration
property.description: The time in milliseconds it takes the dialog to fade in and out

property.name: refocus
property.description: A Toggle to modify the default focus behavior of a Dialog, which is to re-focus the element which had focus before being opened. False will disable refocusing. Default: true

property.name: autofocus
property.description: A Toggle to modify the default focus behavior of a Dialog, which is to focus on the first dialog element after opening the dialog. False will disable autofocusing. Default: true

property.name: _firstFocusItem
property.description: The pointer to the first focusable node in the dialog

property.name: _lastFocusItem
property.description: The pointer to which node has focus prior to our dialog

property.name: doLayout
property.description: Don't change this parameter from the default value. This ContentPane parameter doesn't make sense for Dialog, since Dialog is never a child of a layout container, nor can you specify the size of Dialog in order to control the size of an inner widget.

property.name: draggable
property.description: Toggles the moveable aspect of the Dialog. If true, Dialog can be moved by it's title. If false it will remain centered in the viewport.

method.name: onLoad
method.description: when href is specified we need to reposition the dialog after the data is loaded

method.name: _endDrag
method.description: Called after dragging the Dialog. Calculates the relative offset of the Dialog in relation to the viewport.

method.name: _setup
method.description: stuff we need to do before showing the Dialog for the first time (but we defer it until right beforehand, for performance reasons)

method.name: _size
method.description: Make sure the dialog is small enough to fit in viewport.

method.name: _position
method.description: Position modal dialog in the viewport. If no relative offset in the viewport has been determined (by dragging, for instance), center the node. Otherwise, use the Dialog's stored relative offset, and position the node to top: left: values based on the viewport.

method.name: _onKey
method.description: handles the keyboard events for accessibility reasons

method.name: show
method.description: display the dialog

method.name: hide
method.description: Hide the dialog

method.name: layout
method.description: Position the Dialog and the underlay

object.description: Pops up a dialog that appears like a Tooltip

property.name: title
property.description: Description of tooltip dialog (required for a11Y)

property.name: doLayout
property.description: Don't change this parameter from the default value. This ContentPane parameter doesn't make sense for TooltipDialog, since TooltipDialog is never a child of a layout container, nor can you specify the size of TooltipDialog in order to control the size of an inner widget.

property.name: autofocus
property.description: A Toggle to modify the default focus behavior of a Dialog, which is to focus on the first dialog element after opening the dialog. False will disable autofocusing. Default: true

property.name: _firstFocusItem
property.description: The pointer to the first focusable node in the dialog

property.name: _lastFocusItem
property.description: The domNode that had focus before we took it.

method.name: orient
method.description: configure widget to be displayed in given position relative to the button

method.name: onOpen
method.description: called when dialog is displayed

method.name: _onKey
method.description: keep keyboard focus in dialog; close dialog on escape key

object.description: A rich text Editing widget

property.name: extraPlugins
property.description: a list of extra plugin names which will be appended to plugins array

property.name: editActionInterval
property.description: When using customUndo, not every keystroke will be saved as a step. Instead typing (including delete) will be grouped together: after a user stop typing for editActionInterval seconds, a step will be saved; if a user resume typing within editActionInterval seconds, the timeout will be restarted. By default, editActionInterval is 3 seconds.

method.name: addPlugin
method.description: takes a plugin name as a string or a plugin instance and adds it to the toolbar and associates it with this editor instance. The resulting plugin is added to the Editor's plugins array. If index is passed, it's placed in the plugins array at that index. No big magic, but a nice helper for passing in plugin names via markup.

parameter.name: plugin
parameter.description: String args object or plugin instance args: This object will be passed to the plugin constructor

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: Used when creating an instance from something already in this.plugins. Ensures that the new instance is assigned to this.plugins at that index.

object.description: An element with in-line edit capabilitites

property.name: autoSave
property.description: Changing the value automatically saves it; don't have to push save button (and save button isn't even displayed)

property.name: buttonSave
property.description: Save button label

property.name: buttonCancel
property.description: Cancel button label

property.name: renderAsHtml
property.description: Set this to true if the specified Editor's value should be interpreted as HTML rather than plain text (ie, dijit.Editor)

property.name: editor
property.description: Class name for Editor widget

property.name: editorParams
property.description: Set of parameters for editor, like {required: true}

property.name: width
property.description: Width of editor. By default it's width=100% (ie, block mode)

property.name: value
property.description: The display value of the widget in read-only mode

property.name: noValueIndicator
property.description: The text that gets displayed when there is no value (so that the user has a place to click to edit)

method.name: onChange
method.description: User should set this handler to be notified of changes to value

method.name: onCancel
method.description: User should set this handler to be notified when no change occured

method.name: _setDisabledAttr
method.description: Hook to make attr("disabled", ...) work. Set disabled state of widget.

method.name: edit
method.description: Display the editor widget in place of the original (read only) markup.

method.name: _showText
method.description: revert to display mode, and optionally focus on display node

method.name: save
method.description: Save the contents of the editor and revert to display mode.

parameter.name: focus
parameter.description: Focus on the display mode text

method.name: _setValueAttr
method.description: Hook to make attr("value", ...) work. Inserts specified HTML value into this node, or an "input needed" character if node is blank.

method.name: cancel
method.description: Revert to display mode, discarding any changes made in the editor

object.description: internal widget used by InlineEditBox, displayed when in editing mode to display the editor and maybe save/cancel buttons. Calling code should connect to save/cancel methods to detect when editing is finished Has mainly the same parameters as InlineEditBox, plus these values: style: Object Set of CSS attributes of display node, to replicate in editor value: String Value as an HTML string or plain text string, depending on renderAsHTML flag

method.name: _onKeyPress
method.description: Callback when keypress in the edit box (see template).

method.name: _onBlur
method.description: Called when focus moves outside the editor

method.name: _onChange
method.description: Called when the underlying widget fires an onChange event, which means that the user has finished entering the value

method.name: enableSave
method.description: User replacable function returning a Boolean to indicate if the Save button should be enabled or not - usually due to invalid conditions

property.name: targetNodeIds
property.description: Array of dom node ids of nodes to attach to. Fill this with nodeIds upon widget creation and it becomes context menu for those nodes.

property.name: contextMenuForWindow
property.description: if true, right clicking anywhere on the window will cause this context menu to open; if false, must specify targetNodeIds

property.name: leftClickToOpen
property.description: If true, menu will open on left click instead of right click, similiar to a file menu.

property.name: parentMenu
property.description: pointer to menu that displayed me

property.name: popupDelay
property.description: number of milliseconds before hovering (without clicking) causes the popup to automatically open

property.name: _contextMenuWithMouse
property.description: used to record mouse and keyboard events to determine if a context menu is being opened with the keyboard or the mouse

method.name: onExecute
method.description: attach point for notification about when a menu item has been executed

method.name: onCancel
method.description: attach point for notification about when the user cancels the current menu

method.name: _onKeyPress
method.description: Handle keyboard based menu navigation.

method.name: onItemHover
method.description: Called when cursor is over a MenuItem

method.name: _onChildBlur
method.description: Close all popups that are open and descendants of this menu

method.name: onItemUnhover
method.description: Callback fires when mouse exits a MenuItem

method.name: onItemClick
method.description: user defined function to handle clicks on an item

method.name: _iframeContentWindow
method.description: Returns the window reference of the passed iframe

method.name: _iframeContentDocument
method.description: Returns a reference to the document object inside iframe_el

method.name: bindDomNode
method.description: attach menu to given node

method.name: unBindDomNode
method.description: detach menu from given node

method.name: onOpen
method.description: Open menu relative to the mouse

method.name: onClose
method.description: callback when this menu is closed

method.name: _openPopup
method.description: open the popup to the side of the current menu item

method.name: getPlaceholders
method.description: returns an array of placeholders with the given label. There can be multiples.
method.return-description: An array of placeholders that match the given label

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: Label to search for - if not specified, then all placeholders are returned

object.description: Internal function for opening myself when the user does a right-click or something similar
A line item in a Menu Widget

property.name: label
property.description: menu text

property.name: iconClass
property.description: Class to apply to div in button to make it display an icon

property.name: disabled
property.description: if true, the menu item is disabled if false, the menu item is enabled

method.name: _onHover
method.description: callback when mouse is moved onto menu item

method.name: _onUnhover
method.description: callback when mouse is moved off of menu item

method.name: onClick
method.description: User defined function to handle clicks

method.name: _setDisabledAttr
method.description: Hook for attr('disabled', ...) to work. Enable or disable this menu item.

method.name: _fillContent
method.description: The innerHTML contains both the menu item text and a popup widget
method.example: pick me ...

object.description: A line between two menu items

method.name: isFocusable
method.description: over ride to always return false

object.description: a checkbox-like menu item for toggling on and off

property.name: checked
property.description: Our checked state

method.name: _setCheckedAttr
method.description: Hook so attr('checked', bool) works. Sets the class and state for the check box.

method.name: onChange
method.description: User defined function to handle change events

method.name: _onClick
method.description: Clicking this item just toggles its state

object.description: A progress indication widget

property.name: progress
property.description: (Percentage or Number) initial progress value. with "%": percentage value, 0% <= progress <= 100% or without "%": absolute value, 0 <= progress <= maximum

property.name: maximum
property.description: max sample number

property.name: places
property.description: number of places to show in values; 0 by default

property.name: indeterminate
property.description: If false: show progress. If true: show that a process is underway but that the progress is unknown

method.name: update
method.description: update progress information

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: may provide progress and/or maximum properties on this parameter, see attribute specs for details.

method.name: report
method.description: Generates message to show; may be overridden by user

method.name: onChange
method.description: User definable function fired when progress updates.

object.description: A pane with a title on top, that can be opened or collapsed.

property.name: open
property.description: Whether pane is opened or closed.

property.name: duration
property.description: Time in milliseconds to fade in/fade out

property.name: baseClass
property.description: The root className to use for the various states of this widget

method.name: _setOpenAttr
method.description: Hook to make attr("open", boolean) control the open/closed state of the pane.

parameter.name: open
parameter.description: True if you want to open the pane, false if you want to close it.

method.name: _setContentAttr
method.description: Hook to make attr("content", ...) work. Typically called when an href is loaded. Our job is to make the animation smooth

method.name: toggle
method.description: switches between opened and closed state

method.name: _setCss
method.description: set the open/close css state for the TitlePane

method.name: _onTitleKey
method.description: callback when user hits a key

method.name: _handleFocus
method.description: handle blur and focus for this widget add/removeClass is safe to call without hasClass in this case

method.name: setTitle
method.description: sets the text of the title

object.description: A Toolbar widget, used to hold things like dijit.Editor buttons
A spacer between two Toolbar items

method.name: isFocusable
method.description: This widget isn't focusable, so pass along that fact.

method.name: show
method.description: Display tooltip w/specified contents to right specified node (To left if there's no space on the right, or if LTR==right)

method.name: orient
method.description: private function to set CSS for tooltip node based on which position it's in

method.name: hide
method.description: hide the tooltip

property.name: showDelay
property.description: Number of milliseconds to wait after hovering over/focusing on the object, before the tooltip is displayed.

property.name: connectId
property.description: Id(s) of domNodes to attach the tooltip to. When user hovers over any of the specified dom nodes, the tooltip will appear.

property.name: position
property.description: See description of dijit.Tooltip.defaultPosition for details on position parameter.

method.name: open
method.description: display the tooltip; usually not called directly.

method.name: close
method.description: hide the tooltip or cancel timer for show of tooltip

object.description: Single node within a tree

property.name: label
property.description: Text of this tree node

property.name: state

method.name: markProcessing
method.description: visually denote that tree is loading data, etc.

method.name: unmarkProcessing
method.description: clear markup from markProcessing() call

method.name: _updateItemClasses
method.description: set appropriate CSS classes for icon and label dom node (used to allow for item updates to change respective CSS)

method.name: _updateLayout
method.description: set appropriate CSS classes for this.domNode

method.name: _setExpando
method.description: set the right image for the expando node

method.name: expand
method.description: show my children

method.name: setChildItems
method.description: Sets the child items of this node, removing/adding nodes from current children to match specified items[] array.

method.name: makeExpandable
method.description: if this node wasn't already showing the expando node, turn it into one and call _setExpando()

object.description: This widget displays hierarchical data from a store. A query is specified to get the "top level children" from a data store, and then those items are queried for their children and so on (but lazily, as the user clicks the expand node). Thus in the default mode of operation this widget is technically a forest, not a tree, in that there can be multiple "top level children". However, if you specify label, then a special top level node (not corresponding to any item in the datastore) is created, to father all the top level children.
object.example: {type:'continent'}

property.name: model
property.description: Alternate interface from store to access data (and changes to data) in the tree

property.name: query
property.description: Specifies datastore query to return the root item for the tree. Deprecated functionality: if the query returns multiple items, the tree is given a fake root node (not corresponding to any item in the data store), whose children are the items that match this query. The root node is shown or hidden based on whether a label is specified. Having a query return multiple items is deprecated. If your store doesn't have a root item, wrap the store with dijit.tree.ForestStoreModel, and specify model=myModel

property.name: label
property.description: Deprecated. Use dijit.tree.ForestStoreModel directly instead. Used in conjunction with query parameter. If a query is specified (rather than a root node id), and a label is also specified, then a fake root node is created and displayed, with this label.

property.name: showRoot
property.description: Should the root node be displayed, or hidden?

property.name: childrenAttr
property.description: one ore more attributes that holds children of a tree node

property.name: openOnClick
property.description: If true, clicking a folder node's label will open it, rather than calling onClick()

property.name: persist
property.description: enables/disables use of cookies for state saving.

property.name: dndController
property.description: class name to use as as the dnd controller

method.name: _publish
method.description: Publish a message for this widget/topic

method.name: _store2model
method.description: user specified a store&query rather than model, so create model from store/query

method.name: _load
method.description: initial load of the tree load root node (possibly hidden) and it's children

method.name: mayHaveChildren
method.description: User overridable function to tell if an item has or may have children. Controls whether or not +/- expando icon is shown. (For efficiency reasons we may not want to check if an element actually has children until user clicks the expando node)

method.name: getItemChildren
method.description: User overridable function that return array of child items of given parent item, or if parentItem==null then return top items in tree

method.name: getLabel
method.description: user overridable function to get the label for a tree node (given the item)

method.name: getIconClass
method.description: user overridable function to return CSS class name to display icon

method.name: getLabelClass
method.description: user overridable function to return CSS class name to display label

method.name: _onKeyPress
method.description: translates keypress events into commands for the controller

method.name: _onDownArrow
method.description: down arrow pressed; get next visible node, set focus there

method.name: _onUpArrow
method.description: up arrow pressed; move to previous visible node

method.name: _onRightArrow
method.description: right arrow pressed; go to child node

method.name: _onLeftArrow
method.description: Left arrow pressed. If not collapsed, collapse, else move to parent.

method.name: _onHomeKey
method.description: home pressed; get first visible node, set focus there

method.name: _onEndKey
method.description: end pressed; go to last visible node

method.name: _onLetterKeyNav
method.description: letter key pressed; search for node starting with first char = key

method.name: _onClick
method.description: translates click events into commands for the controller to process

method.name: _onExpandoClick
method.description: user clicked the +/- icon; expand or collapse my children.

method.name: onClick
method.description: user overridable function for executing a tree item

method.name: onOpen
method.description: callback when a node is opened

method.name: onClose
method.description: callback when a node is closed

method.name: _getNextNode
method.description: get next visible node

method.name: _getRootOrFirstNode
method.description: get first visible node

method.name: _collapseNode
method.description: called when the user has requested to collapse the node

method.name: _expandNode
method.description: called when the user has requested to expand the node

method.name: blurNode
method.description: Removes focus from the currently focused node (which must be visible). Usually not called directly (just call focusNode() on another node instead)

method.name: focusNode
method.description: Focus on the specified node (which must be visible)

method.name: _onBlur
method.description: We've moved away from the whole tree. The currently "focused" node (see focusNode above) should remain as the lastFocused node so we can tab back into the tree. Just change CSS to get rid of the dotted border until that time

method.name: _onTreeFocus
method.description: called from onFocus handler of treeitem labelNode to set styles, wai state and tabindex for currently focused treeitem.

method.name: _onItemDelete
method.description: processes notification of a deletion of an item

method.name: _onItemChange
method.description: processes notification of a change to an item's scalar values like label

method.name: _onItemChildrenChange
method.description: processes notification of a change to an item's children

method.name: _saveState
method.description: create and save a cookie with the currently expanded nodes identifiers

method.name: _createTreeNode
method.description: creates a TreeNode

object.description: passed the arguments listed above (store, etc)
object.example: {id:'ROOT'}

property.name: childrenAttrs
property.description: one ore more attributes that holds children of a tree node

property.name: labelAttr
property.description: If specified, get label for tree node from this attribute, rather than by calling store.getLabel()

property.name: root
property.description: Pointer to the root item (read only, not a parameter)

property.name: query
property.description: Specifies datastore query to return the root item for the tree. Must only return a single item. Alternately can just pass in pointer to root item.

method.name: getRoot
method.description: Calls onItem with the root item for the tree, possibly a fabricated item. Calls onError on error.

method.name: mayHaveChildren
method.description: Tells if an item has or may have children. Implementing logic here avoids showing +/- expando icon for nodes that we know don't have children. (For efficiency reasons we may not want to check if an element actually has children until user clicks the expando node)

method.name: getChildren
method.description: Calls onComplete() with array of child items of given parent item, all loaded.

method.name: getLabel
method.description: get the label for an item

method.name: newItem
method.description: Creates a new item. See dojo.data.api.Write for details on args. Used in drag & drop when item from external source dropped onto tree.

method.name: pasteItem
method.description: Move or copy an item from one parent item to another. Used in drag & drop

method.name: onChange
method.description: Callback whenever an item has changed, so that Tree can update the label, icon, etc. Note that changes to an item's children or parent(s) will trigger an onChildrenChange() so you can ignore those changes here.

method.name: onChildrenChange
method.description: Callback to do notifications about new, updated, or deleted items.

method.name: onDelete
method.description: Callback when an item has been deleted.

method.name: _onNewItem
method.description: handler for when new items appear in the store.

method.name: _onDeleteItem
method.description: handler for delete notifications from underlying store

method.name: _onSetItem
method.description: set data event on an item in the store

object.description: Interface between Tree and a dojo.store that doesn't have a root item, ie, has multiple "top level" items. description Use this class to wrap a dojo.store, making all the items matching the specified query appear as children of a fabricated "root item". If no query is specified then all the items returned by fetch() on the underlying store become children of the root item. It allows dijit.Tree to assume a single root item, even if the store doesn't have one.
object.example: {type:'continent'}

property.name: rootLabel
property.description: Label of fabricated root item

property.name: query
property.description: Specifies the set of children of the root item.

method.name: mayHaveChildren
method.description: Tells if an item has or may have children. Implementing logic here avoids showing +/- expando icon for nodes that we know don't have children. (For efficiency reasons we may not want to check if an element actually has children until user clicks the expando node)

method.name: getChildren
method.description: Calls onComplete() with array of child items of given parent item, all loaded.

method.name: newItem
method.description: Creates a new item. See dojo.data.api.Write for details on args. Used in drag & drop when item from external source dropped onto tree.

method.name: onNewRootItem
method.description: User can override this method to modify a new element that's being added to the root of the tree, for example to add a flag like root=true

method.name: pasteItem
method.description: Move or copy an item from one parent item to another. Used in drag & drop

method.name: onAddToRoot
method.description: Called when item added to root of tree; user must override to modify the item so that it matches the query for top level items example store.setValue(item, "root", true);

method.name: onLeaveRoot
method.description: Called when item removed from root of tree; user must override to modify the item so it doesn't match the query for top level items example store.unsetAttribute(item, "root");

method.name: _onNewItem
method.description: handler for when new items appear in the store.

method.name: _onDeleteItem
method.description: handler for delete notifications from underlying store

object.description: A simple GUI for choosing a date in the context of a monthly calendar.
object.example: var calendar = new dijit._Calendar({}, dojo.byId("calendarNode"));

property.name: value
property.description: the currently selected Date

property.name: dayWidth
property.description: How to represent the days of the week in the calendar header. See dojo.date.locale

method.name: _setValueAttr
method.description: Hook to make attr("value", ...) work.

method.name: onValueSelected
method.description: a date cell was selected. It may be the same as the previous value.

method.name: onChange
method.description: called only when the selected date has changed

method.name: isDisabledDate
method.description: May be overridden to disable certain dates in the calendar e.g. `isDisabledDate=dojo.date.locale.isWeekend`

method.name: getClassForDate
method.description: May be overridden to return CSS classes to associate with the date entry for the given dateObject, for example to indicate a holiday in specified locale.

method.name: getParent
method.description: Returns the parent widget of this widget, assuming the parent implements dijit._Container

method.name: getPreviousSibling
method.description: Returns null if this is the first child of the parent, otherwise returns the next element sibling to the "left".

method.name: getNextSibling
method.description: Returns null if this is the last child of the parent, otherwise returns the next element sibling to the "right".

method.name: getIndexInParent
method.description: Returns the index of this widget within its container parent. It returns -1 if the parent does not exist, or if the parent is not a dijit._Container

object.description: Mixin for widgets that contain a set of widget children.

method.name: addChild
method.description: Makes the given widget a child of this widget.

method.name: removeChild
method.description: Removes the passed widget instance from this widget but does not destroy it. You can also pass in an integer indicating the index within the container to remove

method.name: getChildren
method.description: Returns array of children widgets.

method.name: hasChildren
method.description: Returns true if widget has children, i.e. if this.containerNode contains something.

method.name: _getSiblingOfChild
method.description: Get the next or previous widget sibling of child

parameter.name: dir
parameter.description: if 1, get the next sibling if -1, get the previous sibling

method.name: getIndexOfChild
method.description: Gets the index of the child in this container or -1 if not found

method.name: connectKeyNavHandlers
method.description: Call in postCreate() to attach the keyboard handlers to the container. preKeyCodes: Array Key codes for navigating to the previous child.

parameter.name: nextKeyCodes
parameter.description: Key codes for navigating to the next child.

method.name: startupKeyNavChildren
method.description: Call in startup() to set child tabindexes to -1

method.name: addChild
method.description: Add a child to our _Container

method.name: focus
method.description: Default focus() implementation: focus the first child.

method.name: focusFirstChild
method.description: Focus the first focusable child in the container.

method.name: focusNext
method.description: Focus the next widget or focal node (for widgets with multiple focal nodes) within this container.

method.name: focusPrev
method.description: Focus the previous widget or focal node (for widgets with multiple focal nodes) within this container.

method.name: focusChild
method.description: Focus widget. Optionally focus 'node' within widget.

method.name: _startupChild
method.description: Set tabindex="-1" on focusable widgets so that we can focus them programmatically and by clicking. Connect focus and blur handlers.

method.name: _onChildBlur
method.description: Called when focus leaves a child widget to go to a sibling widget.

object.description: Mixin for widgets that are instantiated from a template

property.name: templateNode
property.description: a node that represents the widget template. Pre-empts both templateString and templatePath.

property.name: templateString
property.description: a string that represents the widget template. Pre-empts the templatePath. In builds that have their strings "interned", the templatePath is converted to an inline templateString, thereby preventing a synchronous network call.

property.name: templatePath
property.description: Path to template (HTML file) for this widget relative to dojo.baseUrl

property.name: widgetsInTemplate
property.description: should we parse the template to find widgets that might be declared in markup inside it? false by default.

method.name: buildRendering
method.description: Construct the UI for this widget from a template, setting this.domNode.

method.name: _fillContent
method.description: relocate source contents to templated container node this.containerNode must be able to receive children, or exceptions will be thrown

method.name: _attachTemplateNodes
method.description: Iterate through the template and attach functions and nodes accordingly.

parameter.name: rootNode
parameter.description: the node to search for properties. All children will be searched.

parameter.name: getAttrFunc
parameter.description: a function which will be used to obtain property for a given DomNode/Widget

method.name: getCachedTemplate
method.description: Static method to get a template based on the templatePath or templateString key

parameter.name: templatePath
parameter.description: The URL to get the template from. dojo.uri.Uri is often passed as well.

parameter.name: templateString
parameter.description: a string to use in lieu of fetching the template from a URL. Takes precedence over templatePath Returns: Mixed Either string (if there are ${} variables that need to be replaced) or just a DOM tree (if the node can be cloned directly)

method.name: _sanitizeTemplateString
method.description: Strips <?xml ...?> declarations so that external SVG and XML documents can be added to a document without worry. Also, if the string is an HTML document, only the part inside the body tag is returned.

method.name: _createNodesFromText
method.description: Attempts to create a set of nodes based on the structure of the passed text.

object.description: The foundation of dijit widgets.

property.name: id
property.description: a unique, opaque ID string that can be assigned by users or by the system. If the developer passes an ID which is known not to be unique, the specified ID is ignored and the system-generated ID is used instead.

property.name: lang
property.description: Rarely used. Overrides the default Dojo locale used to render this widget, as defined by the [HTML LANG](http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/dirlang.html#adef-lang) attribute. Value must be among the list of locales specified during by the Dojo bootstrap, formatted according to [RFC 3066](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt) (like en-us).

property.name: dir
property.description: Unsupported by Dijit, but here for completeness. Dijit only supports setting text direction on the entire document. Bi-directional support, as defined by the [HTML DIR](http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/dirlang.html#adef-dir) attribute. Either left-to-right "ltr" or right-to-left "rtl".

property.name: class
property.description: HTML class attribute

property.name: style
property.description: HTML style attribute

property.name: title
property.description: HTML title attribute

property.name: domNode
property.description: This is our visible representation of the widget! Other DOM Nodes may by assigned to other properties, usually through the template system's dojoAttachPoint syntax, but the domNode property is the canonical "top level" node in widget UI.

property.name: containerNode

method.name: onClick
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of mouse click events.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onDblClick
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of mouse double click events.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onKeyDown
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of keys being pressed down.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onKeyPress
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of printable keys being typed.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onKeyUp
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of keys being released.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onMouseDown
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of when the mouse button is pressed down.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onMouseMove
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of when the mouse moves over nodes contained within this widget.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onMouseOut
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of when the mouse moves off of nodes contained within this widget.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onMouseOver
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of when the mouse moves onto nodes contained within this widget.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onMouseLeave
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of when the mouse moves off of this widget.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onMouseEnter
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of when the mouse moves onto this widget.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: onMouseUp
method.description: Connect to this function to receive notifications of when the mouse button is released.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: Event

method.name: postscript
method.description: kicks off widget instantiation, see create() for details.

method.name: create
method.description: Kick off the life-cycle of a widget

parameter.name: params
parameter.description: Hash of initialization parameters for widget, including scalar values (like title, duration etc.) and functions, typically callbacks like onClick.

parameter.name: srcNodeRef
parameter.description: If a srcNodeRef (dom node) is specified: - use srcNodeRef.innerHTML as my contents - if this is a behavioral widget then apply behavior to that srcNodeRef - otherwise, replace srcNodeRef with my generated DOM tree

method.name: _applyAttributes
method.description: Step during widget creation to copy all widget attributes to the DOM as per attributeMap and _setXXXAttr functions.

method.name: postMixInProperties
method.description: Called after the parameters to the widget have been read-in, but before the widget template is instantiated. Especially useful to set properties that are referenced in the widget template.

method.name: buildRendering
method.description: Construct the UI for this widget, setting this.domNode. Most widgets will mixin dijit._Templated, which implements this method.

method.name: postCreate
method.description: Called after a widget's dom has been setup

method.name: startup
method.description: Called after a widget's children, and other widgets on the page, have been created. Provides an opportunity to manipulate any children before they are displayed. This is useful for composite widgets that need to control or layout sub-widgets. Many layout widgets can use this as a wiring phase.

method.name: destroyRecursive
method.description: Destroy this widget and it's descendants. This is the generic "destructor" function that all widget users should call to cleanly discard with a widget. Once a widget is destroyed, it's removed from the manager object.

parameter.name: preserveDom
parameter.description: If true, this method will leave the original Dom structure alone of descendant Widgets. Note: This will NOT work with dijit._Templated widgets.

method.name: destroy
method.description: Destroy this widget, but not its descendants. Will, however, destroy internal widgets such as those used within a template.

parameter.name: preserveDom
parameter.description: If true, this method will leave the original Dom structure alone. Note: This will not yet work with _Templated widgets

method.name: destroyRendering
method.description: Destroys the DOM nodes associated with this widget

parameter.name: preserveDom
parameter.description: If true, this method will leave the original Dom structure alone during tear-down. Note: this will not work with _Templated widgets yet.

method.name: destroyDescendants
method.description: Recursively destroy the children of this widget and their descendants.

parameter.name: preserveDom
parameter.description: If true, the preserveDom attribute is passed to all descendant widget's .destroy() method. Not for use with _Templated widgets. TODO: should I destroy in the reverse order, to go bottom up?

method.name: uninitialize
method.description: stub function. Override to implement custom widget tear-down behavior.

method.name: onFocus
method.description: stub function. Override or connect to this method to receive notifications for when the widget moves into focus.

method.name: onBlur
method.description: stub function. Override or connect to this method to receive notifications for when the widget moves out of focus.

method.name: _onConnect
method.description: Called when someone connects to one of my handlers. "Turn on" that handler if it isn't active yet.

method.name: _attrToDom
method.description: Reflect a widget attribute (title, tabIndex, duration etc.) to the widget DOM, as specified in attributeMap.

method.name: attr
method.description: Set or get properties on a widget instance.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The property to get or set. If an object is passed here and not a string, its keys are used as names of attributes to be set and the value of the object as values to set in the widget.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Optional. If provided, attr() operates as a setter. If omitted, the current value of the named property is returned.

method.name: _getAttrNames
method.description: helper function for Widget.attr() cache attribute name values so we don't do the string ops every time

method.name: toString
method.description: returns a string that represents the widget. When a widget is cast to a string, this method will be used to generate the output. Currently, it does not implement any sort of reversable serialization.

method.name: getDescendants
method.description: Returns all the widgets that contained by this, i.e., all widgets underneath this.containerNode.

method.name: connect
method.description: Connects specified obj/event to specified method of this object and registers for disconnect() on widget destroy.

method.name: disconnect
method.description: Disconnects handle created by this.connect. Also removes handle from this widget's list of connects

method.name: isLeftToRight
method.description: Checks the page for text direction

method.name: isFocusable
method.description: Return true if this widget can currently be focused and false if not

method.name: placeAt
method.description: Place this widget's domNode reference somewhere in the DOM based on standard dojo.place conventions, or passing a Widget reference that contains and addChild member.

parameter.name: reference
parameter.description: The String id of a domNode, a domNode reference, or a reference to a Widget posessing an addChild method.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: If passed a string or domNode reference, the position argument accepts a string just as dojo.place does, one of: "first", "last", "before", or "after". If passed a _Widget reference, and that widget reference has an ".addChild" method, it will be called passing this widget instance into that method, supplying the optional position index passed.

object.description: A graphical time picker. This widget is used internally by other widgets and is not accessible as a standalone widget.

property.name: clickableIncrement
property.description: ISO-8601 string representing the amount by which every clickable element in the time picker increases. Set in local time, without a time zone. Example: `T00:15:00` creates 15 minute increments Must divide dijit._TimePicker.visibleIncrement evenly

property.name: visibleIncrement
property.description: ISO-8601 string representing the amount by which every element with a visible time in the time picker increases. Set in local time, without a time zone. Example: `T01:00:00` creates text in every 1 hour increment

property.name: visibleRange
property.description: ISO-8601 string representing the range of this TimePicker. The TimePicker will only display times in this range. Example: `T05:00:00` displays 5 hours of options

property.name: value
property.description: Date to display. Defaults to current time and date. Can be a Date object or an ISO-8601 string. If you specify the GMT time zone (`-01:00`), the time will be converted to the local time in the local time zone. Otherwise, the time is considered to be in the local time zone. If you specify the date and isDate is true, the date is used. Example: if your local time zone is `GMT -05:00`, `T10:00:00` becomes `T10:00:00-05:00` (considered to be local time), `T10:00:00-01:00` becomes `T06:00:00-05:00` (4 hour difference), `T10:00:00Z` becomes `T05:00:00-05:00` (5 hour difference between Zulu and local time) `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss` is the format to set the date and time Example: `2007-06-01T09:00:00`

property.name: clickableIncrement
property.description: see dijit._TimePicker.clickableIncrement

property.name: visibleIncrement
property.description: see dijit._TimePicker.visibleIncrement

property.name: visibleRange
property.description: see dijit._TimePicker.visibleRange

object.description: attributeMap sets up a "binding" between attributes (aka properties) of the widget and the widget's DOM. Changes to widget attributes listed in attributeMap will be reflected into the DOM. For example, calling attr('title', 'hello') on a TitlePane will automatically cause the TitlePane's DOM to update with the new title. attributeMap is a hash where the key is an attribute of the widget, and the value reflects a binding to a: - DOM node attribute focus: {node: "focusNode", type: "attribute"} Maps this.focus to this.focusNode.focus - DOM node innerHTML title: { node: "titleNode", type: "innerHTML" } Maps this.title to this.titleNode.innerHTML - DOM node CSS class myClass: { node: "domNode", type: "class" } Maps this.myClass to this.domNode.className If the value is an array, then each element in the array matches one of the formats of the above list. There are also some shorthands for backwards compatibility: - string --> { node: string, type: "attribute" }, for example: "focusNode" ---> { node: "focusNode", type: "attribute" } - "" --> { node: "domNode", type: "attribute" }
attributeMap addendum for event handlers that should be connected only on first use
pointer to original dom node
A set of widgets indexed by id

property.name: y
property.description: Integer horizontal coordinate in pixels, relative to document body Integer vertical coordinate in pixels, relative to document body

property.name: y
property.description: Integer horizontal offset in pixels, relative to document body Integer vertical offset in pixels, relative to document body width: Integer width in pixels

property.name: height
property.description: height in pixels

object.description: This class is used to show/hide widgets as popups.

method.name: prepare
method.description: Prepares a node to be used as a popup

method.name: open
method.description: Popup the widget at the specified position

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: popup: Widget widget to display, parent: Widget the button etc. that is displaying this popup around: DomNode DOM node (typically a button); place popup relative to this node orient: Object structure specifying possible positions of popup relative to "around" node onCancel: Function callback when user has canceled the popup by 1. hitting ESC or 2. by using the popup widget's proprietary cancel mechanism (like a cancel button in a dialog); ie: whenever popupWidget.onCancel() is called, args.onCancel is called onClose: Function callback whenever this popup is closed onExecute: Function callback when user "executed" on the popup/sub-popup by selecting a menu choice, etc. (top menu only) examples: 1. opening at the mouse position dijit.popup.open({popup: menuWidget, x: evt.pageX, y: evt.pageY}); 2. opening the widget as a dropdown dijit.popup.open({parent: this, popup: menuWidget, around: this.domNode, onClose: function(){...} }); Note that whatever widget called dijit.popup.open() should also listen to it's own _onBlur callback (fired from _base/focus.js) to know that focus has moved somewhere else and thus the popup should be closed.

method.name: close
method.description: Close specified popup and any popups that it parented

object.description: cache of iframes
For IE z-index schenanigans. id attribute is required.

method.name: destroy
method.description: destroy the iframe

object.description: These functions are used to repetitively call a user specified callback method when a specific key or mouse click over a specific DOM node is held down for a specific amount of time. Only 1 such event is allowed to occur on the browser page at 1 time.

method.name: trigger
method.description: Start a timed, repeating callback sequence. If already started, the function call is ignored. This method is not normally called by the user but can be when the normal listener code is insufficient. Parameters:

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: key or mouse event object

parameter.name: _this
parameter.description: pointer to the user's widget space.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: the DOM node object passed in

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: function to call until the sequence is stopped called with 3 parameters: count: integer representing number of repeated calls (0..n) with -1 indicating the iteration has stopped

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: user space object used to uniquely identify each typematic sequence

parameter.name: subsequentDelay
parameter.description: if > 1, the number of milliseconds until the 3->n events occur or else the fractional time multiplier for the next event's delay, default=0.9

parameter.name: initialDelay
parameter.description: the number of milliseconds until the 2nd event occurs, default=500ms

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop an ongoing timed, repeating callback sequence.

method.name: addKeyListener
method.description: Start listening for a specific typematic key.

parameter.name: keyObject
parameter.description: an object defining the key to listen for. charOrCode: the printable character (string) or keyCode (number) to listen for. keyCode: (deprecated - use charOrCode) the keyCode (number) to listen for (implies charCode = 0). charCode: (deprecated - use charOrCode) the charCode (number) to listen for. ctrlKey: desired ctrl key state to initiate the calback sequence: pressed (true) released (false) either (unspecified) altKey: same as ctrlKey but for the alt key shiftKey: same as ctrlKey but for the shift key See the trigger method for other parameters. Returns an array of dojo.connect handles

method.name: addMouseListener
method.description: Start listening for a typematic mouse click. See the trigger method for other parameters. Returns an array of dojo.connect handles

method.name: addListener
method.description: Start listening for a specific typematic key and mouseclick. This is a thin wrapper to addKeyListener and addMouseListener.

parameter.name: mouseNode
parameter.description: the DOM node object to listen on for mouse events.

parameter.name: keyNode
parameter.description: the DOM node object to listen on for key events. See the addMouseListener and addKeyListener methods for other parameters. Returns an array of dojo.connect handles

method.name: onload
method.description: Detects if we are in high-contrast mode or not

method.name: escapeXml
method.description: Adds escape sequences for special characters in XML: &<>"' Optionally skips escapes for single quotes

method.name: getChildrenHtml
method.description: Returns the html content of a DomNode and children

object.description: dijit._editor.RichText is the core of dijit.Editor, which provides basic WYSIWYG editing features.

property.name: inheritWidth
property.description: whether to inherit the parent's width or simply use 100%

property.name: focusOnLoad
property.description: whether focusing into this instance of richtext when page onload

property.name: name
property.description: If a save name is specified the content is saved and restored when the user leave this page can come back, or if the editor is not properly closed after editing has started.

property.name: styleSheets
property.description: semicolon (";") separated list of css files for the editing area

property.name: _content
property.description: temporary content storage

property.name: height
property.description: set height to fix the editor at a specific height, with scrolling. By default, this is 300px. If you want to have the editor always resizes to accommodate the content, use AlwaysShowToolbar plugin and set height="". If this editor is used within a layout widget, set height="100%".

property.name: minHeight
property.description: The minimum height that the editor should have

property.name: _SEPARATOR
property.description: used to concat contents from multiple textareas into a single string

property.name: onLoadDeferred
property.description: deferred which is fired when the editor finishes loading

property.name: isTabIndent
property.description: used to allow tab key and shift-tab to indent and outdent rather than navigate

property.name: events
property.description: events which should be connected to the underlying editing area, events in this array will be addListener with capture=true

property.name: contentPreFilters
property.description: pre content filter function register array. these filters will be executed before the actual editing area get the html content

method.name: setupDefaultShortcuts
method.description: add some default key handlers

method.name: open
method.description: Transforms the node referenced in this.domNode into a rich text editing node.

method.name: _drawIframe
method.description: Draws an iFrame using the existing one if one exists. Used by Mozilla, Safari, and Opera

method.name: _applyEditingAreaStyleSheets
method.description: apply the specified css files in styleSheets

method.name: addStyleSheet
method.description: add an external stylesheet for the editing area

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: a dojo.uri.Uri pointing to the url of the external css file

method.name: removeStyleSheet
method.description: remove an external stylesheet for the editing area

method.name: onKeyDown
method.description: Fired on keydown

method.name: onKeyUp
method.description: Fired on keyup

method.name: _setValueAttr
method.description: registers that attr("value", foo) should call setValue(foo)

method.name: addKeyHandler
method.description: add a handler for a keyboard shortcut

method.name: _onFocus
method.description: Fired on focus

method.name: blur
method.description: remove focus from this instance

method.name: focus
method.description: move focus to this instance

method.name: onDisplayChanged
method.description: This event will be fired everytime the display context changes and the result needs to be reflected in the UI.

method.name: onNormalizedDisplayChanged
method.description: This event is fired every updateInterval ms or more

method.name: onChange
method.description: this is fired if and only if the editor loses focus and the content is changed

method.name: _normalizeCommand
method.description: Used as the advice function by dojo.connect to map our normalized set of commands to those supported by the target browser

method.name: queryCommandAvailable
method.description: Tests whether a command is supported by the host. Clients SHOULD check whether a command is supported before attempting to use it, behaviour for unsupported commands is undefined.

parameter.name: command
parameter.description: The command to test for

return-type.type: Boolean return true if the command is supported, false otherwise

method.name: execCommand
method.description: Executes a command in the Rich Text area

parameter.name: command
parameter.description: The command to execute

parameter.name: argument
parameter.description: optional argument to the command

method.name: queryCommandEnabled
method.description: check whether a command is enabled or not

method.name: queryCommandState
method.description: check the state of a given command and returns true or false

method.name: queryCommandValue
method.description: check the value of a given command. This matters most for custom selections and complex values like font value setting

method.name: _sCall
method.description: run the named method of dijit._editor.selection over the current editor instance's window, with the passed args

method.name: placeCursorAtStart
method.description: place the cursor at the start of the editing area

method.name: placeCursorAtEnd
method.description: place the cursor at the end of the editing area

method.name: getValue
method.description: return the current content of the editing area (post filters are applied)

parameter.name: nonDestructive
parameter.description: defaults to false. Should the post-filtering be run over a copy of the live DOM? Most users should pass "true" here unless they *really* know that none of the installed filters are going to mess up the editing session.

method.name: _getValueAttr
method.description: hook to make attr("value") work

method.name: setValue
method.description: This function sets the content. No undo history is preserved.

method.name: replaceValue
method.description: this function set the content while trying to maintain the undo stack (now only works fine with Moz, this is identical to setValue in all other browsers)

method.name: _preFilterContent
method.description: filter the input before setting the content of the editing area. DOM pre-filtering may happen after this string-based filtering takes place but as of 1.2, this is not gauranteed for operations such as the inserthtml command.

method.name: _preDomFilterContent
method.description: filter the input's live DOM. All filter operations should be considered to be "live" and operating on the DOM that the user will be interacting with in their editing session.

method.name: _postFilterContent
method.description: filter the output after getting the content of the editing area

parameter.name: dom
parameter.description: a node, set of nodes, which to filter using each of the current members of the contentDomPostFilters and contentPostFilters arrays.

parameter.name: nonDestructive
parameter.description: defaults to "false". If true, ensures that filtering happens on a clone of the passed-in content and not the actual node itself.

method.name: _saveContent
method.description: Saves the content in an onunload event if the editor has not been closed

method.name: escapeXml
method.description: Adds escape sequences for special characters in XML: &<>"' Optionally skips escapes for single quotes

method.name: close
method.description: Kills the editor and optionally writes back the modified contents to the element from which it originated.

parameter.name: save
parameter.description: Whether or not to save the changes. If false, the changes are discarded.

return-type.type: Boolean: whether the content has been modified

method.name: destroyRendering
method.description: stub

method.name: _fixContentForMoz
method.description: Moz can not handle strong/em tags correctly, convert them to b/i

object.description: handler after the content of the document finishes loading
For auto-expanding editors, this plugin will keep the editor's toolbar visible even when the top of the editor has scrolled off the top of the viewport (usually when editing a long document).
object.example: <div dojoType="dijit.Editor" height="" extraPlugins="['dijit._editor.plugins.AlwaysShowToolbar']">

method.name: _updateHeight
method.description: Updates the height of the editor area to fit the contents.

object.description: This plugin tries to make all browsers have identical behavior when the user presses the ENTER key. Specifically, it fixes the double-spaced line problem on IE.

method.name: handleEnterKey
method.description: Manually handle enter key event to make the behavior consistant across all supported browsers. See property blockNodeForEnter for available options let browser handle this TODO: delete. this code will never fire because onKeyPress --> handleEnterKey is only called when blockNodeForEnter != null

method.name: _fixNewLineBehaviorForIE
method.description: Insert CSS so <p> nodes don't have spacing around them, thus hiding the fact that ENTER key on IE is creating new paragraphs

method.name: regularPsToSingleLinePs
method.description: Converts a <p> node containing <br>'s into multiple <p> nodes.

method.name: singleLinePsToRegularPs
method.example:
Given this input:

line 1

line 2

  1. item 1
  2. item 2

line 3

line 4

Will convert to:

line 1
line 2

  1. item 1
  2. item 2

line 3
line 4

Not sure why this situation would even come up after the pre-filter and the enter-key-handling code.

object.description: This plugin provides three dropdowns for setting font information in the editor
This plugin provides dialogs for inserting links and images into the editor

method.name: setValue

object.description: This plugin is used to allow the use of the tab and shift-tab keys to indent/outdent list items. This overrides the default behavior of moving focus from/to the toolbar
This plugin provides dropdown color pickers for setting text color and background color
This plugin is used to toggle direction of the edited document only, no matter what direction the whole page is.

property.name: showLabel
property.description: Set this to true to hide the label text and display only the icon. (If showLabel=false then iconClass must be specified.) Especially useful for toolbars. If showLabel=true, the label will become the title (a.k.a. tooltip/hint) of the icon. The exception case is for computers in high-contrast mode, where the label will still be displayed, since the icon doesn't appear.

method.name: hasNextFocalNode
method.description: Returns true if this widget has no node currently focused or if there is a node following the focused one. False is returned if the last node has focus.

method.name: focusNext
method.description: Focus the focal node following the current node with focus or the first one if no node currently has focus.

method.name: hasPrevFocalNode
method.description: Returns true if this widget has no node currently focused or if there is a node before the focused one. False is returned if the first node has focus.

method.name: focusPrev
method.description: Focus the focal node before the current node with focus or the last one if no node currently has focus.

method.name: getFocalNodes
method.description: Returns an array of focal nodes for this widget.

object.description: A button that can be in two states (checked or not). Can be base class for things like tabs or checkbox or radio buttons

object.description: Same as an HTML checkbox, but with fancy styling.

property.name: value
property.description: As an initialization parameter, equivalent to value field on normal checkbox (if checked, the value is passed as the value when form is submitted). However, attr('value') will return either the string or false depending on whether or not the checkbox is checked. attr('value', string) will check the checkbox and change the value to the specified string attr('value', boolean) will change the checked state.

object.description: Widget corresponding to HTML form tag, for validation and serialization

<form dojoType="dijit.form.Form" id="myForm">

		</form>
		myObj = {name: "John Doe"};
		dijit.byId('myForm').attr('value', myObj);
		myObj=dijit.byId('myForm').attr('value');

method.name: validate
method.description: returns if the form is valid - same as isValid - but provides a few additional (ui-specific) features. 1 - it will highlight any sub-widgets that are not valid 2 - it will call focus() on the first invalid sub-widget

method.description: Fill in form values from according to an Object (in the format returned by attr('value'))

method.name: _widgetChange
method.description: connected to a widgets onChange function - update our valid state, if needed.

method.name: connectChildren
method.description: connects to the onChange function of all children to track valid state changes. You can call this function directly, ie. in the event that you programmatically add a widget to the form *after* the form has been initialized

method.name: execute
method.description: Deprecated: use submit()

method.name: onExecute
method.description: Deprecated: use onSubmit()

method.name: onReset
method.description: Callback when user resets the form. This method is intended to be over-ridden. When the `reset` method is called programmatically, the return value from `onReset` is used to compute whether or not resetting should proceed

method.name: onSubmit
method.description: Callback when user submits the form. This method is intended to be over-ridden, but by default it checks and returns the validity of form elements. When the `submit` method is called programmatically, the return value from `onSubmit` is used to compute whether or not submission should proceed

method.name: submit
method.description: programmatically submit form if and only if the `onSubmit` returns true

property.name: displayedValue
property.description: For subclasses like ComboBox where the displayed value (ex: Kentucky) and the serialized value (ex: KY) are different, this represents the displayed value. Setting 'displayedValue' through attr('displayedValue', ...) updates 'value', and vice-versa. Othewise 'value' is updated from 'displayedValue' periodically, like onBlur etc. TODO: move declaration to MappedTextBox? Problem is that ComboBox references displayedValue, for benefit of FilteringSelect.
