object.description: user-defined object needed to pass parameters to the validator functions

A dijit.form.ValidationTextBox subclass which provides a visible formatted display and a serializable value in a hidden input field which is actually sent to the server. The visible display may be locale-dependent and interactive. The value sent to the server is stored in a hidden input field which uses the `name` attribute declared by the original widget. That value sent to the serveris defined by the dijit.form.MappedTextBox.serialize method and is typically locale-neutral.

method.name: serialize
method.description: user replaceable function used to convert the attr('value') result to a String

method.name: toString
method.description: display the widget as a printable string using the widget's value TODO: seems like the filter() call here is unnecessary as attr('value') should do that

object.description: A dijit.form.MappedTextBox subclass which defines a range of valid values

property.name: rangeMessage
property.description: The message to display if value is out-of-range

method.name: rangeCheck
method.description: user replaceable function used to validate the range of the numeric input value

method.name: isInRange
method.description: Need to over-ride with your own validation code in subclasses

method.name: _isDefinitelyOutOfRange
method.description: Returns true if the value is out of range and will remain out of range even if the user types more characters

method.name: _setValueAttr
method.description: Hook so attr('value', ...) works.

property.name: locale
property.description: locale used for validation, picks up value from this widget's lang attribute

property.name: _flags_
property.description: various flags passed to regExpGen function

property.name: min
property.description: Minimum signed value. Default is -Infinity

property.name: max
property.description: Maximum signed value. Default is +Infinity

object.description: A validating, serializable, range-bound date or time text box.

property.name: value
property.description: The value of this widget as a JavaScript Date object. Use attr("value") / attr("value", val) to manipulate. When passed to the parser in markup, must be specified according to `dojo.date.stamp.fromISOString`

property.name: popupClass
property.description: Name of the popup widget class used to select a date/time

method.name: format
method.description: formats the value as a Date, according to constraints

method.name: parse
method.description: parses the value as a Date, according to constraints

method.name: _onFocus
method.description: open the TimePicker popup

method.name: _setValueAttr
method.description: Sets the date on this textbox. Note that `value` must be a Javascript Date object.

method.name: _open
method.description: opens the TimePicker, and sets the onValueSelected value

method.name: _onBlur
method.description: called magically when focus has shifted away from this widget and it's dropdown

object.description: _FormWidget's correspond to native HTML elements such as <checkbox> or <button>.

property.name: baseClass
property.description: Root CSS class of the widget (ex: dijitTextBox), used to add CSS classes of widget (ex: "dijitTextBox dijitTextBoxInvalid dijitTextBoxFocused dijitTextBoxInvalidFocused") See _setStateClass().

property.name: name
property.description: Name used when submitting form; same as "name" attribute or plain HTML elements

property.name: alt
property.description: Corresponds to the native HTML <input> element's attribute.

property.name: value
property.description: Corresponds to the native HTML <input> element's attribute.

property.name: type
property.description: Corresponds to the native HTML <input> element's attribute.

property.name: tabIndex
property.description: Order fields are traversed when user hits the tab key

property.name: disabled
property.description: Should this widget respond to user input? In markup, this is specified as "disabled='disabled'", or just "disabled".

property.name: readOnly
property.description: Should this widget respond to user input? In markup, this is specified as "readOnly". Similar to disabled except readOnly form values are submitted

property.name: intermediateChanges
property.description: Fires onChange for each value change or only on demand

method.name: setDisabled
method.description: Set disabled state of widget (Deprecated).

method.name: _onMouse
method.description: Sets _hovering, _active, and stateModifier properties depending on mouse state, then calls setStateClass() to set appropriate CSS classes for this.domNode. To get a different CSS class for hover, send onmouseover and onmouseout events to this method. To get a different CSS class while mouse button is depressed, send onmousedown to this method.

method.name: compare
method.description: compare 2 values

method.name: onChange
method.description: callback when value is changed

method.name: _handleOnChange
method.description: set the value of the widget.

method.name: _layoutHack
method.description: work around table sizing bugs on FF2 by forcing redraw

method.name: _setValueAttr
method.description: Hook so attr('value', value) works.

method.name: _getValueAttr
method.description: Hook so attr('value') works.

method.name: undo
method.description: restore the value to the last value passed to onChange

property.name: timeoutChangeRate
property.description: fraction of time used to change the typematic timer between events 1.0 means that each typematic event fires at defaultTimeout intervals < 1.0 means that each typematic event fires at an increasing faster rate

property.name: smallDelta
property.description: adjust the value by this much when spinning using the arrow keys/buttons

property.name: largeDelta
property.description: adjust the value by this much when spinning using the PgUp/Dn keys

method.name: adjust
method.description: user replaceable function used to adjust a primitive value(Number/Date/...) by the delta amount specified the val is adjusted in a way that makes sense to the object type

method.name: _mouseWheeled
method.description: Mouse wheel listener where supported

object.description: Holds a set of panes where every pane's title is visible, but only one pane's content is visible at a time, and switching between panes is visualized by sliding the other panes up/down.
object.example:
...

This is some text

| ...

property.name: duration
property.description: Amount of time (in ms) it takes to slide panes

method.name: _getTargetHeight
method.description: For the given node, returns the height that should be set to achieve our vertical space (subtract any padding we may have)

method.name: layout
method.description: Set the height of the open pane based on what room remains

object.description: AccordionPane is a ContentPane with a title that may contain another widget. Nested layout widgets, such as SplitContainer, are not supported at this time.
object.example: see dijit.layout.AccordionContainer

method.name: getTitleHeight
method.description: returns the height of the title dom node

method.name: _onTitleClick
method.description: callback when someone clicks my title

method.name: _onTitleEnter
method.description: callback when someone hovers over my title

method.name: _onTitleLeave
method.description: callback when someone stops hovering over my title

method.name: _handleFocus
method.description: handle the blur and focus state of this widget

method.name: setSelected
method.description: change the selected state on this pane

method.name: onSelected
method.description: called when this pane is selected

object.description: Provides layout in 5 regions, a center and borders along its 4 sides.
object.example:
header text
table of contents
client area

property.name: gutters
property.description: Give each pane a border and margin. Margin determined by domNode.paddingLeft. When false, only resizable panes have a gutter (i.e. draggable splitter) for resizing.

property.name: liveSplitters
property.description: specifies whether splitters resize as you drag (true) or only upon mouseup (false)

property.name: persist
property.description: Save splitter positions in a cookie.

property.name: _splitterClass
property.description: Optional hook to override the default Splitter widget used by BorderContainer

method.name: getSplitter
method.description: returns the widget responsible for rendering the splitter associated with region

object.description: A draggable spacer between two items in a BorderContainer

property.name: live
property.description: If true, the child's size changes and the child widget is redrawn as you drag the splitter; otherwise, the size doesn't change until you drop the splitter (by mouse-up)

object.description: Just a spacer div to separate side pane from center pane. Basically a trick to lookup the gutter/splitter width from the theme.
A widget that acts as a Container for other widgets, and includes a ajax interface
object.example: Some quick samples: To change the innerHTML use .attr('content', 'new content') Or you can send it a NodeList, .attr('content', dojo.query('div [class=selected]', userSelection)) please note that the nodes in NodeList will copied, not moved To do a ajax update use .attr('href', url)

property.name: content
property.description: The innerHTML of the ContentPane. Note that the initialization parameter / argument to attr("content", ...) can be a String, DomNode, Nodelist, or widget.

property.name: extractContent
property.description: Extract visible content from inside of <body> .... </body>

property.name: parseOnLoad
property.description: parse content and create the widgets, if any

property.name: preventCache
property.description: Cache content retreived externally

property.name: preload
property.description: Force load of data even if pane is hidden.

property.name: refreshOnShow
property.description: Refresh (re-download) content when pane goes from hidden to shown

property.name: loadingMessage
property.description: Message that shows while downloading

property.name: errorMessage
property.description: Message that shows if an error occurs

property.name: isLoaded
property.description: Tells loading status see onLoad|onUnload for event hooks

property.name: doLayout
property.description: - false - don't adjust size of children - true - if there is a single visible child widget, set it's size to however big the ContentPane is

method.name: _checkIfSingleChild
method.description: Test if we have exactly one visible widget as a child, and if so assume that we are a container for that widget, and should propogate startup() and resize() calls to it. Skips over things like data stores since they aren't visible.

method.name: refresh
method.description: Force a refresh (re-download) of content, be sure to turn off cache

method.name: _setHrefAttr
method.description: Hook so attr("href", ...) works.

parameter.name: href
parameter.description: url to the page you want to get, must be within the same domain as your mainpage

method.name: _setContentAttr
method.description: Hook to make attr("content", ...) work. Replaces old content with data content, include style classes from old content

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: the new Content may be String, DomNode or NodeList if data is a NodeList (or an array of nodes) nodes are copied so you can import nodes from another document implicitly

method.name: _getContentAttr
method.description: hook to make attr("content") work

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancels a inflight download of content

method.name: destroyRecursive
method.description: Destroy the ContentPane and it's contents

method.name: _isShown
method.description: returns true if the content is currently shown

method.name: _onLoadHandler
method.description: This is called whenever new content is being loaded

method.name: _onUnloadHandler
method.description: This is called whenever the content is being unloaded

method.name: destroyDescendants
method.description: Destroy all the widgets inside the ContentPane and empty containerNode

method.name: _setContent
method.description: Insert the content into the container node

method.name: _createSubWidgets
method.description: scan my contents and create subwidgets

method.name: onLoad
method.description: Event hook, is called after everything is loaded and widgetified

method.name: onUnload
method.description: Event hook, is called before old content is cleared

method.name: onDownloadStart
method.description: called before download starts the string returned by this function will be the html that tells the user we are loading something override with your own function if you want to change text

method.name: onContentError
method.description: called on DOM faults, require fault etc in content default is to display errormessage inside pane

method.name: onDownloadError
method.description: Called when download error occurs, default is to display errormessage inside pane. Overide function to change that. The string returned by this function will be the html that tells the user a error happend

method.name: onDownloadEnd
method.description: called when download is finished

property.name: global
property.description: Alias for the global scope (e.g. the window object in a browser).

property.name: locale
property.description: the locale as defined by Dojo (read-only)

property.name: isBrowser
property.description: True if the client is a web-browser

property.name: isFF
property.description: | undefined Version as a Number if client is FireFox. undefined otherwise. Corresponds to major detected FireFox version (1.5, 2, 3, etc.)

property.name: isIE
property.description: | undefined Version as a Number if client is MSIE(PC). undefined otherwise. Corresponds to major detected IE version (6, 7, 8, etc.)

property.name: isSafari
property.description: | undefined Version as a Number if client is Safari or iPhone. undefined otherwise.

property.name: isKhtml
property.description: | undefined Version as a Number if client is a KTHML-derived browser (Konqueror, Safari, etc.). undefined otherwise. Corresponds to major detected version.

property.name: isMozilla
property.description: | undefined Version as a Number if client is a Mozilla-based browser (Firefox, SeaMonkey). undefined otherwise. Corresponds to major detected version.

property.name: isOpera
property.description: | undefined Version as a Number if client is Opera. undefined otherwise. Corresponds to major detected version.

property.name: baseUrl
property.description: The root relative path to dojo.js (as a string)

property.name: doc
property.description: Alias for the current document. 'dojo.doc' can be modified for temporary context shifting. Also see dojo.withDoc().

property.name: isSpidermonkey
property.description: Detect spidermonkey

property.name: tests
property.description: D.O.H. Test files for Dojo unit testing.

method.name: blendColors
method.description: blend colors end and start with weight from 0 to 1, 0.5 being a 50/50 blend, can reuse a previously allocated dojo.Color object for the result

method.name: colorFromRgb
method.description: get rgb(a) array from css-style color declarations

method.name: colorFromHex
method.description: converts a hex string with a '#' prefix to a color object. Supports 12-bit #rgb shorthand.

method.name: colorFromArray
method.description: builds a color from 1, 2, 3, or 4 element array

method.name: colorFromString
method.description: parses str for a color value.
method.return-description: a dojo.Color object. If obj is passed, it will be the return value.

method.name: deprecated
method.description: Log a debug message to indicate that a behavior has been deprecated.

parameter.name: behaviour
parameter.description: The API or behavior being deprecated. Usually in the form of "myApp.someFunction()".

parameter.name: extra
parameter.description: Text to append to the message.

parameter.name: removal
parameter.description: Text to indicate when in the future the behavior will be removed.

method.example: dojo.deprecated("myApp.getTemp()", "use myApp.getLocaleTemp() instead", "1.0");

method.name: _mixin
method.description: Adds all properties and methods of props to obj. This addition is "prototype extension safe", so that instances of objects will not pass along prototype defaults.

method.name: mixin
method.description: Adds all properties and methods of props to obj and returns the (now modified) obj.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: The object to mix properties into. Also the return value.

parameter.name: props
parameter.description: One or more objects whose values are successively copied into obj. If more than one of these objects contain the same value, the one specified last in the function call will "win".

method.example: make a shallow copy of an object var copy = dojo.mixin({}, source);

method.name: setObject
method.description: Set a property from a dot-separated string, such as "A.B.C"

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Path to a property, in the form "A.B.C".

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: Optional. Object to use as root of path. Defaults to `dojo.global`.

method.name: getObject
method.description: Get a property from a dot-separated string, such as "A.B.C"

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Path to an property, in the form "A.B.C".

parameter.name: create
parameter.description: Optional. Defaults to `false`. If `true`, Objects will be created at any point along the 'path' that is undefined.

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: Optional. Object to use as root of path. Defaults to 'dojo.global'. Null may be passed.

method.name: exists
method.description: determine if an object supports a given method

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Path to an object, in the form "A.B.C".

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: to use as root of path. Defaults to 'dojo.global'. Null may be passed.

method.name: eval
method.description: Perform an evaluation in the global scope. Use this rather than calling 'eval()' directly.
method.return-description: The result of the evaluation. Often `undefined`

method.name: experimental
method.description: Marks code as experimental.

parameter.name: moduleName
parameter.description: The name of a module, or the name of a module file or a specific function

parameter.name: extra
parameter.description: some additional message for the user

method.example: dojo.experimental("dojo.data.Result");

method.name: _xhrObj
method.description: does the work of portably generating a new XMLHTTPRequest object.

method.name: _getText
method.description: Read the contents of the specified uri and return those contents.
method.return-description: The response text. null is returned when there is a failure and failure is okay (an exception otherwise)

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: A relative or absolute uri. If absolute, it still must be in the same "domain" as we are.

parameter.name: fail_ok
parameter.description: Default false. If fail_ok and loading fails, return null instead of throwing.

method.name: windowUnloaded
method.description: signal fired by impending window destruction. You may use dojo.addOnWIndowUnload() or dojo.connect() to this method to perform page/application cleanup methods. See dojo.addOnWindowUnload for more info.

method.name: addOnWindowUnload
method.description: registers a function to be triggered when window.onunload fires. Be careful trying to modify the DOM or access JavaScript properties during this phase of page unloading: they may not always be available. Consider dojo.addOnUnload() if you need to modify the DOM or do heavy JavaScript work.

method.name: byId
method.description: Returns DOM node with matching `id` attribute or `null` if not found, similar to "$" function in another library. If `id` is a DomNode, this function is a no-op.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: A string to match an HTML id attribute or a reference to a DOM Node

parameter.name: doc
parameter.description: Document to work in. Defaults to the current value of dojo.doc. Can be used to retrieve node references from other documents.

method.name: _loadUri
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Overrides loadUri() from loader.js. xd loading requires slightly different behavior from loadPath().

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: a uri which points at the script to be loaded

parameter.name: cb
parameter.description: a callback function to process the result of evaluating the script as an expression, typically used by the resource bundle loader to load JSON-style resources

method.name: body
method.description: Return the body element of the document return the body object associated with dojo.doc
method.example: dojo.body().appendChild(dojo.doc.createElement('div'));

method.name: _loadPath
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Overrides loadPath() from loader.js. xd loading requires slightly different behavior from loadPath().

parameter.name: relpath
parameter.description: A relative path to a script (no leading '/', and typically ending in '.js').

parameter.name: module
parameter.description: A module whose existance to check for after loading a path. Can be used to determine success or failure of the load.

parameter.name: cb
parameter.description: a callback function to pass the result of evaluating the script

method.name: _loadUriAndCheck
method.description: calls loadUri then findModule and returns true if both succeed

method.name: loaded
method.description: signal fired when initial environment and package loading is complete. You may use dojo.addOnLoad() or dojo.connect() to this method in order to handle initialization tasks that require the environment to be initialized. In a browser host, declarative widgets will be constructed when this function finishes runing.

method.name: unloaded
method.description: signal fired by impending environment destruction. You may use dojo.addOnUnload() or dojo.connect() to this method to perform page/application cleanup methods. See dojo.addOnUnload for more info.

method.name: addOnLoad
method.description: Registers a function to be triggered after the DOM has finished loading and widgets declared in markup have been instantiated. Images and CSS files may or may not have finished downloading when the specified function is called. (Note that widgets' CSS and HTML code is guaranteed to be downloaded before said widgets are instantiated.)

method.name: addOnUnload
method.description: registers a function to be triggered when the page unloads. In a browser enviroment, the functions will be triggered during the window.onbeforeunload event. Be careful doing work during window.onbeforeunload. onbeforeunload can be triggered if a link to download a file is clicked, or if the link is a javascript: link. In these cases, the onbeforeunload event fires, but the document is not actually destroyed. So be careful about doing destructive operations in a dojo.addOnUnload callback.

method.name: _getModuleSymbols
method.description: Converts a module name in dotted JS notation to an array representing the path in the source tree

method.name: loadInit
method.description: Executes a function that needs to be executed for the loader's dojo.requireIf resolutions to work. This is needed mostly for the xdomain loader case where a function needs to be executed to set up the possible values for a dojo.requireIf call.

parameter.name: init
parameter.description: a function reference. Executed immediately.

method.name: require
method.description: loads a Javascript module from the appropriate URI
method.return-description: the required namespace object

parameter.name: moduleName
parameter.description: module name to load, using periods for separators, e.g. "dojo.date.locale". Module paths are de-referenced by dojo's internal mapping of locations to names and are disambiguated by longest prefix. See `dojo.registerModulePath()` for details on registering new modules.

parameter.name: omitModuleCheck
parameter.description: if `true`, omitModuleCheck skips the step of ensuring that the loaded file actually defines the symbol it is referenced by. For example if it called as `dojo.require("a.b.c")` and the file located at `a/b/c.js` does not define an object `a.b.c`, and exception will be throws whereas no exception is raised when called as `dojo.require("a.b.c", true)`

method.name: provide
method.description: Each javascript source file must have at least one `dojo.provide()` call at the top of the file, corresponding to the file name. For example, `js/dojo/foo.js` must have `dojo.provide("dojo.foo");` before any calls to `dojo.require()` are made.

method.name: platformRequire
method.description: require one or more modules based on which host environment Dojo is currently operating in

method.name: requireIf
method.description: If the condition is true then call dojo.require() for the specified resource

method.name: registerModulePath
method.description: maps a module name to a path
method.example: If your dojo.js is located at this location in the web root: /myapp/js/dojo/dojo/dojo.js and your modules are located at: /myapp/js/foo/bar.js /myapp/js/foo/baz.js /myapp/js/foo/thud/xyzzy.js Your application can tell Dojo to locate the "foo" namespace by calling: dojo.registerModulePath("foo", "../../foo"); At which point you can then use dojo.require() to load the modules (assuming they provide() the same things which are required). The full code might be: <script type="text/javascript" src="/myapp/js/dojo/dojo/dojo.js"></script> <script type="text/javascript"> dojo.registerModulePath("foo", "../../foo"); dojo.require("foo.bar"); dojo.require("foo.baz"); dojo.require("foo.thud.xyzzy"); </script>

method.name: requireLocalization
method.description: loads a bundle intelligently based on whether the module is local or xd. Overrides the local-case implementation.

parameter.name: moduleName
parameter.description: name of the package containing the "nls" directory in which the bundle is found

parameter.name: bundleName
parameter.description: bundle name, i.e. the filename without the '.js' suffix

parameter.name: locale
parameter.description: the locale to load (optional) By default, the browser's user locale as defined by dojo.locale

parameter.name: availableFlatLocales
parameter.description: A comma-separated list of the available, flattened locales for this bundle. This argument should only be set by the build process.

method.example: A particular widget may define one or more resource bundles, structured in a program as follows, where moduleName is mycode.mywidget and bundleNames available include bundleone and bundletwo: ... mycode/ mywidget/ nls/ bundleone.js (the fallback translation, English in this example) bundletwo.js (also a fallback translation) de/ bundleone.js bundletwo.js de-at/ bundleone.js en/ (empty; use the fallback translation) en-us/ bundleone.js en-gb/ bundleone.js es/ bundleone.js bundletwo.js ...etc ...

method.name: moduleUrl
method.description: Returns a `dojo._Url` object relative to a module.

method.name: _xdReset
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Resets the xd state.

method.name: _xdCreateResource
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Creates an xd module source given an non-xd module contents.

method.name: _xdIsXDomainPath
method.description: Figure out whether the path is local or x-domain If there is a colon before the first / then, we have a URL with a protocol.

method.name: _xdResourceLoaded
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Called by an xd module resource when it has been loaded via a script tag. Evaluate the function with scopeArgs for multiversion support.

method.name: _xdLoadFlattenedBundle
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Used when loading a flattened localized bundle via a script tag.

method.name: xdRequireLocalization
method.description: Internal xd loader function. The xd version of dojo.requireLocalization.

method.name: _xdUnpackDependency
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Determines what to do with a dependency that was listed in an xd version of a module contents.

method.name: _xdWalkReqs
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Walks the requires and evaluates module resource contents in the right order.

method.name: _xdEvalReqs
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Does a depth first, breadth second search and eval of required modules.

method.name: _xdClearInterval
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Clears the interval timer used to check on the status of in-flight xd module resource requests.

method.name: _xdWatchInFlight
method.description: Internal xd loader function. Monitors in-flight requests for xd module resources.

method.name: indexOf
method.description: locates the first index of the provided value in the passed array. If the value is not found, -1 is returned.

method.name: lastIndexOf
method.description: locates the last index of the provided value in the passed array. If the value is not found, -1 is returned.

method.name: forEach
method.description: for every item in arr, callback is invoked. Return values are ignored.

parameter.name: arr
parameter.description: the array to iterate over. If a string, operates on individual characters.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: a function is invoked with three arguments: item, index, and array

parameter.name: thisObject
parameter.description: may be used to scope the call to callback

method.name: every
method.description: Determines whether or not every item in arr satisfies the condition implemented by callback.

parameter.name: arr
parameter.description: the array to iterate on. If a string, operates on individual characters.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: a function is invoked with three arguments: item, index, and array and returns true if the condition is met.

parameter.name: thisObject
parameter.description: may be used to scope the call to callback

method.example: // returns false dojo.every([1, 2, 3, 4], function(item){ return item>1; });

method.name: some
method.description: Determines whether or not any item in arr satisfies the condition implemented by callback.

parameter.name: arr
parameter.description: the array to iterate over. If a string, operates on individual characters.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: a function is invoked with three arguments: item, index, and array and returns true if the condition is met.

parameter.name: thisObject
parameter.description: may be used to scope the call to callback

method.example: // is true dojo.some([1, 2, 3, 4], function(item){ return item>1; });

method.name: map
method.description: applies callback to each element of arr and returns an Array with the results

parameter.name: arr
parameter.description: the array to iterate on. If a string, operates on individual characters.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: a function is invoked with three arguments, (item, index, array), and returns a value

parameter.name: thisObject
parameter.description: may be used to scope the call to callback

method.example: // returns [2, 3, 4, 5] dojo.map([1, 2, 3, 4], function(item){ return item+1 });

method.name: filter
method.description: Returns a new Array with those items from arr that match the condition implemented by callback.

parameter.name: arr
parameter.description: the array to iterate over.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: a function that is invoked with three arguments (item, index, array). The return of this function is expected to be a boolean which determines whether the passed-in item will be included in the returned array.

parameter.name: thisObject
parameter.description: may be used to scope the call to callback

method.example: // returns [2, 3, 4] dojo.filter([1, 2, 3, 4], function(item){ return item>1; });

method.name: connect
method.description: Create a link that calls one function when another executes.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: The source object for the event function. Defaults to dojo.global if null. If obj is a DOM node, the connection is delegated to the DOM event manager (unless dontFix is true).

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: name of the event function in obj. I.e. identifies a property obj[event].

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: The object that method will receive as "this". If context is null and method is a function, then method inherits the context of event. If method is a string then context must be the source object object for method (context[method]). If context is null, dojo.global is used.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: A function reference, or name of a function in context. The function identified by method fires after event does. method receives the same arguments as the event. See context argument comments for information on method's scope.

parameter.name: dontFix
parameter.description: If obj is a DOM node, set dontFix to true to prevent delegation of this connection to the DOM event manager.

method.name: disconnect
method.description: Remove a link created by dojo.connect.

parameter.name: handle
parameter.description: the return value of the dojo.connect call that created the connection.

method.name: connectPublisher
method.description: Ensure that everytime obj.event() is called, a message is published on the topic. Returns a handle which can be passed to dojo.disconnect() to disable subsequent automatic publication on the topic.

parameter.name: topic
parameter.description: The name of the topic to publish.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: The source object for the event function. Defaults to dojo.global if null.

parameter.name: event
parameter.description: The name of the event function in obj. I.e. identifies a property obj[event].

method.example: dojo.connectPublisher("/ajax/start", dojo, "xhrGet");

method.name: fixEvent
method.description: normalizes properties on the event object including event bubbling methods, keystroke normalization, and x/y positions

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: native event object

parameter.name: sender
parameter.description: node to treat as "currentTarget"

method.name: stopEvent
method.description: prevents propagation and clobbers the default action of the passed event

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: The event object. If omitted, window.event is used on IE.

method.name: _fade
method.description: Returns an animation that will fade the node defined by args.node from the start to end values passed (args.start args.end) (end is mandatory, start is optional)

method.name: fadeIn
method.description: Returns an animation that will fade node defined in 'args' from its current opacity to fully opaque.

method.name: fadeOut
method.description: Returns an animation that will fade node defined in 'args' from its current opacity to fully transparent.

method.name: _defaultEasing
method.description: The default easing function for dojo._Animation(s)

method.name: anim
method.description: A simpler interface to `dojo.animateProperty()`, also returns an instance of `dojo._Animation` but begins the animation immediately, unlike nearly every other Dojo animation API.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: a DOM node or the id of a node to animate CSS properties on

parameter.name: duration
parameter.description: The number of milliseconds over which the animation should run. Defaults to the global animation default duration (350ms).

parameter.name: easing
parameter.description: An easing function over which to calculate acceleration and deceleration of the animation through its duration. A default easing algorithm is provided, but you may plug in any you wish. A large selection of easing algorithms are available in `dojo.fx.easing`.

parameter.name: onEnd
parameter.description: A function to be called when the animation finishes running.

parameter.name: delay
parameter.description: The number of milliseconds to delay beginning the animation by. The default is 0.

method.example: Fade out a node dojo.anim("id", { opacity: 0 });

method.name: getComputedStyle
method.description: Returns a "computed style" object.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: A reference to a DOM node. Does NOT support taking an ID string for speed reasons.

method.example: dojo.getComputedStyle(dojo.byId('foo')).borderWidth;

method.name: _getOpacity
method.description: Returns the current opacity of the passed node as a floating-point value between 0 and 1.
method.return-description: Number between 0 and 1

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: a reference to a DOM node. Does NOT support taking an ID string for speed reasons.

method.name: _setOpacity
method.description: set the opacity of the passed node portably. Returns the new opacity of the node.
method.return-description: Number between 0 and 1

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: a reference to a DOM node. Does NOT support taking an ID string for performance reasons.

parameter.name: opacity
parameter.description: A Number between 0 and 1. 0 specifies transparent.

method.name: _destroyElement
method.description: removes node from its parent, clobbers it and all of its children.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: the element to be destroyed, either as an ID or a reference

method.name: isDescendant
method.description: Returns true if node is a descendant of ancestor

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or node reference to test

parameter.name: ancestor
parameter.description: id or node reference of potential parent to test against

method.name: setSelectable
method.description: enable or disable selection on a node

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or reference to node

method.name: place
method.description: Attempt to insert node into the DOM, choosing from various positioning options. Returns true if successful, false otherwise.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or node reference to place relative to refNode

parameter.name: refNode
parameter.description: id or node reference to use as basis for placement

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: string noting the position of node relative to refNode or a number indicating the location in the childNodes collection of refNode. Accepted string values are: * before * after * first * last "first" and "last" indicate positions as children of refNode. position defaults to "last" if not specified

method.name: style
method.description: Accesses styles on a node. If 2 arguments are passed, acts as a getter. If 3 arguments are passed, acts as a setter.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or reference to node to get/set style for

parameter.name: style
parameter.description: the style property to set in DOM-accessor format ("borderWidth", not "border-width") or an object with key/value pairs suitable for setting each property.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: If passed, sets value on the node for style, handling cross-browser concerns.

method.name: _getPadExtents
method.description: Returns object with special values specifically useful for node fitting. * l/t = left/top padding (respectively) * w = the total of the left and right padding * h = the total of the top and bottom padding If 'node' has position, l/t forms the origin for child nodes. The w/h are used for calculating boxes. Normally application code will not need to invoke this directly, and will use the ...box... functions instead.

method.name: _getBorderExtents
method.description: returns an object with properties useful for noting the border dimensions. * l/t = the sum of left/top border (respectively) * w = the sum of the left and right border * h = the sum of the top and bottom border The w/h are used for calculating boxes. Normally application code will not need to invoke this directly, and will use the ...box... functions instead.

method.name: _getPadBorderExtents
method.description: returns object with properties useful for box fitting with regards to padding. * l/t = the sum of left/top padding and left/top border (respectively) * w = the sum of the left and right padding and border * h = the sum of the top and bottom padding and border The w/h are used for calculating boxes. Normally application code will not need to invoke this directly, and will use the ...box... functions instead.

method.name: _getMarginExtents
method.description: returns object with properties useful for box fitting with regards to box margins (i.e., the outer-box). * l/t = marginLeft, marginTop, respectively * w = total width, margin inclusive * h = total height, margin inclusive The w/h are used for calculating boxes. Normally application code will not need to invoke this directly, and will use the ...box... functions instead.

method.name: _getMarginBox
method.description: returns an object that encodes the width, height, left and top positions of the node's margin box.

method.name: _getContentBox
method.description: Returns an object that encodes the width, height, left and top positions of the node's content box, irrespective of the current box model.

method.name: _setBox
method.description: sets width/height/left/top in the current (native) box-model dimentions. Uses the unit passed in u.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: DOM Node reference. Id string not supported for performance reasons.

parameter.name: l
parameter.description: optional. left offset from parent.

parameter.name: t
parameter.description: optional. top offset from parent.

parameter.name: w
parameter.description: optional. width in current box model.

parameter.name: h
parameter.description: optional. width in current box model.

parameter.name: u
parameter.description: optional. unit measure to use for other measures. Defaults to "px".

method.name: _isButtonTag
method.description: True if the node is BUTTON or INPUT.type="button".

method.name: _usesBorderBox
method.description: True if the node uses border-box layout.

method.name: _setContentSize
method.description: Sets the size of the node's contents, irrespective of margins, padding, or borders.

method.name: _setMarginBox
method.description: sets the size of the node's margin box and placement (left/top), irrespective of box model. Think of it as a passthrough to dojo._setBox that handles box-model vagaries for you.

method.name: marginBox
method.description: Getter/setter for the margin-box of node.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or reference to DOM Node to get/set box for

parameter.name: box
parameter.description: If passed, denotes that dojo.marginBox() should update/set the margin box for node. Box is an object in the above format. All properties are optional if passed.

method.name: contentBox
method.description: Getter/setter for the content-box of node.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or reference to DOM Node to get/set box for

parameter.name: box
parameter.description: If passed, denotes that dojo.contentBox() should update/set the content box for node. Box is an object in the above format. All properties are optional if passed.

method.name: _abs
method.description: Gets the position of the passed element relative to the viewport (if includeScroll==false), or relative to the document root (if includeScroll==true). Returns an object of the form: { x: 100, y: 300 } if includeScroll is passed, the x and y values will include any document offsets that may affect the position relative to the viewport.

method.name: coords
method.description: Returns an object that measures margin box width/height and absolute positioning data from dojo._abs().

method.name: hasAttr
method.description: Returns true if the requested attribute is specified on the given element, and false otherwise.
method.return-description: true if the requested attribute is specified on the given element, and false otherwise

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or reference to the element to check

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the name of the attribute

method.name: attr
method.description: Gets or sets an attribute on an HTML element.
method.return-description: when used as a getter, the value of the requested attribute or null if that attribute does not have a specified or default value; when user as a setter, undefined

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or reference to the element to get or set the attribute on

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the name of the attribute to get or set.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to set for the attribute

method.name: removeAttr
method.description: Removes an attribute from an HTML element.

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: id or reference to the element to remove the attribute from

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the name of the attribute to remove

method.name: hasClass
method.description: Returns whether or not the specified classes are a portion of the class list currently applied to the node.

method.name: addClass
method.description: Adds the specified classes to the end of the class list on the passed node.

method.name: removeClass
method.description: Removes the specified classes from node.

method.name: toggleClass
method.description: Adds a class to node if not present, or removes if present. Pass a boolean condition if you want to explicitly add or remove.

parameter.name: condition
parameter.description: If passed, true means to add the class, false means to remove.

method.name: fromJson
method.description: Parses a [JSON](http://json.org) string to return a JavaScript object. Throws for invalid JSON strings.

parameter.name: json
parameter.description: a string literal of a JSON item, for instance: `'{ "foo": [ "bar", 1, { "baz": "thud" } ] }'`

method.name: _escapeString
method.description: Adds escape sequences for non-visual characters, double quote and backslash and surrounds with double quotes to form a valid string literal.

method.name: toJson
method.description: Returns a [JSON](http://json.org) serialization of an object.

parameter.name: it
parameter.description: an object to be serialized. Objects may define their own serialization via a special "__json__" or "json" function property. If a specialized serializer has been defined, it will be used as a fallback.

parameter.name: prettyPrint
parameter.description: if true, we indent objects and arrays to make the output prettier. The variable dojo.toJsonIndentStr is used as the indent string -- to use something other than the default (tab), change that variable before calling dojo.toJson().

parameter.name: _indentStr
parameter.description: private variable for recursive calls when pretty printing, do not use.

method.name: isString
method.description: Return true if it is a String

method.name: isArray
method.description: Return true if it is an Array

method.name: isFunction
method.description: Return true if it is a Function

method.name: isObject
method.description: Returns true if it is a JavaScript object (or an Array, a Function or null)

method.name: isArrayLike
method.description: similar to dojo.isArray() but more permissive
method.return-description: If it walks like a duck and quicks like a duck, return `true`

method.name: isAlien
method.description: Returns true if it is a built-in function or some other kind of oddball that *should* report as a function but doesn't

method.name: extend
method.description: Adds all properties and methods of props to constructor's prototype, making them available to all instances created with constructor.

method.name: hitch
method.description: Returns a function that will only ever execute in the a given scope. This allows for easy use of object member functions in callbacks and other places in which the "this" keyword may otherwise not reference the expected scope. Any number of default positional arguments may be passed as parameters beyond "method". Each of these values will be used to "placehold" (similar to curry) for the hitched function.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.description: The scope to use when method executes. If method is a string, scope is also the object containing method.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: A function to be hitched to scope, or the name of the method in scope to be hitched.

method.example: dojo.hitch(foo, "bar")(); runs foo.bar() in the scope of foo

method.name: delegate
method.description: returns a new object which "looks" to obj for properties which it does not have a value for. Optionally takes a bag of properties to seed the returned object with initially.
method.return-description: an Object of anonymous type

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: object to delegate to for properties not found directly on the return object or in props.

parameter.name: props
parameter.description: object containing properties to assign to the returned object

method.name: _toArray
method.description: Converts an array-like object (i.e. arguments, DOMCollection) to an array. Returns a new Array with the elements of obj.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: the object to "arrayify". We expect the object to have, at a minimum, a length property which corresponds to integer-indexed properties.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.description: the location in obj to start iterating from. Defaults to 0. Optional.

parameter.name: startWith
parameter.description: An array to pack with the properties of obj. If provided, properties in obj are appended at the end of startWith and startWith is the returned array.

method.name: partial
method.description: similar to hitch() except that the scope object is left to be whatever the execution context eventually becomes.

method.name: clone
method.description: Clones objects (including DOM nodes) and all children. Warning: do not clone cyclic structures.

method.name: trim
method.description: trims whitespaces from both sides of the string

method.name: query
method.description: Returns nodes which match the given CSS3 selector, searching the entire document by default but optionally taking a node to scope the search by. Returns an instance of dojo.NodeList.
method.return-description: dojo.NodeList An instance of `dojo.NodeList`. Many methods are available on NodeLists for searching, iterating, manipulating, and handling events on the matched nodes in the returned list.

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: The CSS3 expression to match against. For details on the syntax of CSS3 selectors, see <http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-selectors/#selectors>

parameter.name: root
parameter.description: A DOMNode (or node id) to scope the search from. Optional.

method.example: search the entire document for elements with the class "foo": dojo.query(".foo"); these elements will match:

method.name: setContext
method.description: changes the behavior of many core Dojo functions that deal with namespace and DOM lookup, changing them to work in a new global context (e.g., an iframe). The varibles dojo.global and dojo.doc are modified as a result of calling this function and the result of `dojo.body()` likewise differs.

method.name: withGlobal
method.description: Call callback with globalObject as dojo.global and globalObject.document as dojo.doc. If provided, globalObject will be executed in the context of object thisObject

method.name: withDoc
method.description: Call callback with documentObject as dojo.doc. If provided, callback will be executed in the context of object thisObject

method.name: formToObject
method.description: dojo.formToObject returns the values encoded in an HTML form as string properties in an object which it then returns. Disabled form elements, buttons, and other non-value form elements are skipped. Multi-select elements are returned as an array of string values.

method.name: objectToQuery
method.description: takes a name/value mapping object and returns a string representing a URL-encoded version of that object.

method.name: formToQuery
method.description: Returns a URL-encoded string representing the form passed as either a node or string ID identifying the form to serialize

method.name: formToJson
method.description: return a serialized JSON string from a form node or string ID identifying the form to serialize

method.name: queryToObject
method.description: returns an object representing a de-serialized query section of a URL. Query keys with multiple values are returned in an array.

method.name: _ioSetArgs
method.description: sets up the Deferred and ioArgs property on the Deferred so it can be used in an io call.

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: The args object passed into the public io call. Recognized properties on the args object are:

parameter.name: canceller
parameter.description: The canceller function used for the Deferred object. The function will receive one argument, the Deferred object that is related to the canceller.

parameter.name: okHandler
parameter.description: The first OK callback to be registered with Deferred. It has the opportunity to transform the OK response. It will receive one argument -- the Deferred object returned from this function.

parameter.name: errHandler
parameter.description: The first error callback to be registered with Deferred. It has the opportunity to do cleanup on an error. It will receive two arguments: error (the Error object) and dfd, the Deferred object returned from this function.

method.name: _ioCancelAll
method.description: Cancels all pending IO requests, regardless of IO type (xhr, script, iframe).

method.name: _ioWatch
method.description: watches the io request represented by dfd to see if it completes.

parameter.name: dfd
parameter.description: The Deferred object to watch.

parameter.name: validCheck
parameter.description: used to check if the IO request is still valid. Gets the dfd object as its only argument.

parameter.name: ioCheck
parameter.description: used to check if basic IO call worked. Gets the dfd object as its only argument.

parameter.name: resHandle
parameter.description: used to process response. Gets the dfd object as its only argument.

method.name: _ioAddQueryToUrl
method.description: Adds query params discovered by the io deferred construction to the URL. Only use this for operations which are fundamentally GET-type operations.

method.name: xhr
method.description: Sends an HTTP request with the given method.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: HTTP method to be used, such as GET, POST, PUT, DELETE. Should be uppercase.

parameter.name: hasBody
parameter.description: If the request has an HTTP body, then pass true for hasBody.

method.name: xhrGet
method.description: Sends an HTTP GET request to the server.

method.name: xhrPost
method.description: Sends an HTTP POST request to the server. In addtion to the properties listed for the dojo.__XhrArgs type, the following property is allowed: postData: String. Send raw data in the body of the POST request.

method.name: xhrPut
method.description: Sends an HTTP PUT request to the server. In addtion to the properties listed for the dojo.__XhrArgs type, the following property is allowed: putData: String. Send raw data in the body of the PUT request.

method.name: xhrDelete
method.description: Sends an HTTP DELETE request to the server.

object.description: A registry to make contextual calling/searching easier.

method.name: register
method.description: register a check function to determine if the wrap function or object gets selected

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: a way to identify this matcher.

parameter.name: check
parameter.description: a function that arguments are passed to from the adapter's match() function. The check function should return true if the given arguments are appropriate for the wrap function.

parameter.name: directReturn
parameter.description: If directReturn is true, the value passed in for wrap will be returned instead of being called. Alternately, the AdapterRegistry can be set globally to "return not call" using the returnWrappers property. Either way, this behavior allows the registry to act as a "search" function instead of a function interception library.

parameter.name: override
parameter.description: If override is given and true, the check function will be given highest priority. Otherwise, it will be the lowest priority adapter.

method.name: match
method.description: Find an adapter for the given arguments. If no suitable adapter is found, throws an exception. match() accepts any number of arguments, all of which are passed to all matching functions from the registered pairs.

method.name: unregister
method.description: Remove a named adapter from the registry

object.description: Provides event handling for a group of Deferred objects.

property.name: canceller
property.description: deferred canceller function, see dojo.Deferred

property.name: fireOnOneCallback
property.description: cause the DeferredLists callback to be fired as soon as any of the deferreds in its list have been fired instead of waiting until the entire list has finished fireonOneErrback: Will cause the errback to fire upon any of the deferreds errback

method.name: _cbDeferred
method.description: The DeferredLists' callback handler

method.name: gatherResults
method.description: Gathers the results of the deferreds for packaging as the parameters to the Deferred Lists' callback

object.description: list of deferreds to be synchronizied with this DeferredList

dojo.NodeList is as subclass of Array which adds syntactic sugar for chaining, common iteration operations, animation, and node manipulation. NodeLists are most often returned as the result of dojo.query() calls.
object.example: create a node list from a node new dojo.NodeList(dojo.byId("foo"));

method.name: wipeIn
method.description: wipe in all elements of this NodeList. Returns an instance of dojo._Animation
method.example: Fade in all tables with class "blah": dojo.query("table.blah").wipeIn().play();

method.name: wipeOut
method.description: wipe out all elements of this NodeList. Returns an instance of dojo._Animation
method.example: Wipe out all tables with class "blah": dojo.query("table.blah").wipeOut().play();

method.name: slideTo
method.description: slide all elements of the node list to the specified place. Returns an instance of dojo._Animation

method.name: fadeIn
method.description: fade in all elements of this NodeList. Returns an instance of dojo._Animation
method.example: Fade in all tables with class "blah": dojo.query("table.blah").fadeIn().play();

method.name: fadeOut
method.description: fade out all elements of this NodeList. Returns an instance of dojo._Animation
method.example: Fade out all elements with class "zork": dojo.query(".zork").fadeOut().play();

method.name: animateProperty
method.description: see dojo.animateProperty(). Animate all elements of this NodeList across the properties specified.

method.name: anim
method.description: Animate one or more CSS properties for all nodes in this list. The returned animation object will already be playing when it is returned. See the docs for `dojo.anim` for full details.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: the properties to animate

parameter.name: duration
parameter.description: Optional. The time to run the animations for

parameter.name: easing
parameter.description: Optional. The easing function to use.

parameter.name: onEnd
parameter.description: A function to be called when the animation ends

parameter.name: delay
parameter.description: how long to delay playing the returned animation

method.example: Another way to fade out: dojo.query(".thinger").anim({ opacity: 0 });

method.name: html
method.description: see `dojo.html.set()`. Set the content of all elements of this NodeList

method.name: slice
method.description: Returns a new NodeList, maintaining this one in place

parameter.name: begin
parameter.description: Can be a positive or negative integer, with positive integers noting the offset to begin at, and negative integers denoting an offset from the end (i.e., to the left of the end)

parameter.name: end
parameter.description: Optional parameter to describe what position relative to the NodeList's zero index to end the slice at. Like begin, can be positive or negative.

method.name: splice
method.description: Returns a new NodeList, manipulating this NodeList based on the arguments passed, potentially splicing in new elements at an offset, optionally deleting elements
method.return-description: dojo.NodeList

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: begin can be a positive or negative integer, with positive integers noting the offset to begin at, and negative integers denoting an offset from the end (i.e., to the left of the end)

parameter.name: howmany
parameter.description: Optional parameter to describe what position relative to the NodeList's zero index to end the slice at. Like begin, can be positive or negative.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: Any number of optional parameters may be passed in to be spliced into the NodeList

method.name: concat
method.description: Returns a new NodeList comprised of items in this NodeList as well as items passed in as parameters
method.return-description: dojo.NodeList

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: Any number of optional parameters may be passed in to be spliced into the NodeList

method.name: indexOf
method.description: see dojo.indexOf(). The primary difference is that the acted-on array is implicitly this NodeList
method.return-description: Positive Integer or 0 for a match, -1 of not found.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to search for.

parameter.name: fromIndex
parameter.description: The loction to start searching from. Optional. Defaults to 0.

method.name: lastIndexOf
method.description: see dojo.lastIndexOf(). The primary difference is that the acted-on array is implicitly this NodeList
method.return-description: Positive Integer or 0 for a match, -1 of not found.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to search for.

parameter.name: fromIndex
parameter.description: The loction to start searching from. Optional. Defaults to 0.

method.name: every
method.description: see `dojo.every()` and: <http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Core_JavaScript_1.5_Reference:Global_Objects:Array:every> Takes the same structure of arguments and returns as dojo.every() with the caveat that the passed array is implicitly this NodeList

method.name: some
method.description: see dojo.some() and: http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Core_JavaScript_1.5_Reference:Global_Objects:Array:some Takes the same structure of arguments and returns as dojo.some() with the caveat that the passed array is implicitly this NodeList

method.name: map
method.description: see dojo.map(). The primary difference is that the acted-on array is implicitly this NodeList and the return is a dojo.NodeList (a subclass of Array)

method.name: forEach
method.description: see dojo.forEach(). The primary difference is that the acted-on array is implicitly this NodeList

method.name: coords
method.description: Returns the box objects all elements in a node list as an Array (*not* a NodeList)

method.name: attr
method.description: gets or sets the DOM attribute for every element in the NodeList
method.return-description: if no value is passed, the result is an array of attribute values If a value is passed, the return is this NodeList

parameter.name: property
parameter.description: the attribute to get/set

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: optional. The value to set the property to

method.name: style
method.description: gets or sets the CSS property for every element in the NodeList
method.return-description: if no value is passed, the result is an array of strings. If a value is passed, the return is this NodeList

parameter.name: property
parameter.description: the CSS property to get/set, in JavaScript notation ("lineHieght" instead of "line-height")

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: optional. The value to set the property to

method.name: addClass
method.description: adds the specified class to every node in the list

parameter.name: className
parameter.description: the CSS class to add

method.name: removeClass
method.description: removes the specified class from every node in the list
method.return-description: dojo.NodeList, this list

parameter.name: className
parameter.description: the CSS class to add

method.name: toggleClass
method.description: Adds a class to node if not present, or removes if present. Pass a boolean condition if you want to explicitly add or remove.

parameter.name: className
parameter.description: the CSS class to add

parameter.name: condition
parameter.description: If passed, true means to add the class, false means to remove.

method.name: connect
method.description: attach event handlers to every item of the NodeList. Uses dojo.connect() so event properties are normalized

parameter.name: methodName
parameter.description: the name of the method to attach to. For DOM events, this should be the lower-case name of the event

parameter.name: objOrFunc
parameter.description: if 2 arguments are passed (methodName, objOrFunc), objOrFunc should reference a function or be the name of the function in the global namespace to attach. If 3 arguments are provided (methodName, objOrFunc, funcName), objOrFunc must be the scope to locate the bound function in

parameter.name: funcName
parameter.description: optional. A string naming the function in objOrFunc to bind to the event. May also be a function reference.

method.name: place
method.description: places elements of this node list relative to the first element matched by queryOrNode. Returns the original NodeList.

parameter.name: queryOrNode
parameter.description: may be a string representing any valid CSS3 selector or a DOM node. In the selector case, only the first matching element will be used for relative positioning.

parameter.name: position

method.name: orphan
method.description: removes elements in this list that match the simple filter from their parents and returns them as a new NodeList.
method.return-description: `dojo.NodeList` containing the orpahned elements

parameter.name: simpleFilter
parameter.description: single-expression CSS filter

method.name: adopt
method.description: places any/all elements in queryOrListOrNode at a position relative to the first element in this list. Returns a dojo.NodeList of the adopted elements.

parameter.name: queryOrListOrNode
parameter.description: a DOM node or a query string or a query result. Represents the nodes to be adopted relative to the first element of this NodeList.

parameter.name: position

method.name: query
method.description: Returns a new, flattened NodeList. Elements of the new list satisfy the passed query but use elements of the current NodeList as query roots.

method.name: filter
method.description: "masks" the built-in javascript filter() method to support passing a simple string filter in addition to supporting filtering function objects.

method.name: addContent
method.description: add a node or some HTML as a string to every item in the list. Returns the original list.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: the HTML in string format to add at position to every item

parameter.name: position

method.example: appends content to the end if the position is ommitted dojo.query("h3 > p").addContent("hey there!");

method.name: empty
method.description: clears all content from each node in the list

method.name: instantiate
method.description: Create a new instance of a specified class, using the specified properties and each node in the nodeList as a srcNodeRef

method.name: at
method.description: Returns a new NodeList comprised of items in this NodeList at the given index or indices.
method.return-description: dojo.NodeList

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: One or more 0-based indices of items in the current NodeList.

parameter.name: template
parameter.description: The template string or location

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: The context object or location

method.name: sizeTo
method.description: size all elements of this NodeList. Returns an instance of dojo._Animation

method.name: slideBy
method.description: slide all elements of this NodeList. Returns an instance of dojo._Animation
method.example: // slide all tables with class "blah" 10 px dojo.query("table.blah").slideBy({ top:10, left:10 }).play();

method.name: highlight
method.description: highlight all elements of the node list. Returns an instance of dojo._Animation
method.example: // highlight all links with class "foo" dojo.query("a.foo").hightlight().play();

method.name: fadeTo
method.description: fade all elements of the node list to a specified opacity
method.example: // fade all elements with class "bar" to to 50% opacity dojo.query(".bar").fadeTo({ end: 0.5 }).play();

method.name: wipeTo
method.description: Wipe all elements of the NodeList to a specified width: or height:
method.example: dojo.query(".box").wipeTo({ width: 300px }).play();

takes a named string, hex string, array of rgb or rgba values, an object with r, g, b, and a properties, or another dojo.Color object

object.description: Encapsulates a sequence of callbacks in response to a value that may not yet be available. This is modeled after the Deferred class from Twisted <http://twistedmatrix.com>.

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancels a Deferred that has not yet received a value, or is waiting on another Deferred as its value.

method.name: _resback
method.description: The private primitive that means either callback or errback

method.name: callback
method.description: Begin the callback sequence with a non-error value.

method.name: errback
method.description: Begin the callback sequence with an error result.

method.name: addBoth
method.description: Add the same function as both a callback and an errback as the next element on the callback sequence.This is useful for code that you want to guarantee to run, e.g. a finalizer.

method.name: addCallback
method.description: Add a single callback to the end of the callback sequence.

method.name: addErrback
method.description: Add a single callback to the end of the callback sequence.

method.name: addCallbacks
method.description: Add separate callback and errback to the end of the callback sequence.

method.name: _fire
method.description: Used internally to exhaust the callback sequence when a result is available.

object.description: Application code can set the global 'djConfig' prior to loading the library to override certain global settings for how dojo works.

property.name: isDebug
property.description: Defaults to `false`. If set to `true`, ensures that Dojo provides extended debugging feedback via Firebug. If Firebug is not available on your platform, setting `isDebug` to `true` will force Dojo to pull in (and display) the version of Firebug Lite which is integrated into the Dojo distribution, thereby always providing a debugging/logging console when `isDebug` is enabled. Note that Firebug's `console.*` methods are ALWAYS defined by Dojo. If `isDebug` is false and you are on a platform without Firebug, these methods will be defined as no-ops.

property.name: debugAtAllCosts
property.description: Defaults to `false`. If set to `true`, this triggers an alternate mode of the package system in which dependencies are detected and only then are resources evaluated in dependency order via `<script>` tag inclusion. This may double-request resources and cause problems with scripts which expect `dojo.require()` to preform synchronously. `debugAtAllCosts` can be an invaluable debugging aid, but when using it, ensure that all code which depends on Dojo modules is wrapped in `dojo.addOnLoad()` handlers. Due to the somewhat unpredictable side-effects of using `debugAtAllCosts`, it is strongly recommended that you enable this flag as a last resort. `debugAtAllCosts` has no effect when loading resources across domains. For usage information, see the [Dojo Book](http://dojotoolkit.org/book/book-dojo/part-4-meta-dojo-making-your-dojo-code-run-faster-and-better/debugging-facilities/deb)

property.name: locale
property.description: The locale to assume for loading localized resources in this page, specified according to [RFC 3066](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3066.txt). Must be specified entirely in lowercase, e.g. `en-us` and `zh-cn`. See the documentation for `dojo.i18n` and `dojo.requireLocalization` for details on loading localized resources. If no locale is specified, Dojo assumes the locale of the user agent, according to `navigator.userLanguage` or `navigator.language` properties.

property.name: extraLocale
property.description: No default value. Specifies additional locales whose resources should also be loaded alongside the default locale when calls to `dojo.requireLocalization()` are processed.

property.name: baseUrl
property.description: The directory in which `dojo.js` is located. Under normal conditions, Dojo auto-detects the correct location from which it was loaded. You may need to manually configure `baseUrl` in cases where you have renamed `dojo.js` or in which `<base>` tags confuse some browsers (e.g. IE 6). The variable `dojo.baseUrl` is assigned either the value of `djConfig.baseUrl` if one is provided or the auto-detected root if not. Other modules are located relative to this path.

property.name: afterOnLoad
property.description: Indicates Dojo was added to the page after the page load. In this case Dojo will not wait for the page DOMContentLoad/load events and fire its dojo.addOnLoad callbacks after making sure all outstanding dojo.required modules have loaded.

property.name: require
property.description: An array of module names to be loaded immediately after dojo.js has been included in a page.

method.name: addOnLoad
method.description: or Array Adds a callback via dojo.addOnLoad. Useful when Dojo is added after the page loads and djConfig.afterOnLoad is true. Supports the same arguments as dojo.addOnLoad. When using a function reference, use `djConfig.addOnLoad = function(){};`. For object with function name use `djConfig.addOnLoad = [myObject, "functionName"];` and for object with function reference use `djConfig.addOnLoad = [myObject, function(){}];`

object.description: version number of dojo

property.name: major
property.description: Major version. If total version is "1.2.0beta1", will be 1 minor: Integer Minor version. If total version is "1.2.0beta1", will be 2 patch: Integer Patch version. If total version is "1.2.0beta1", will be 0 flag: String Descriptor flag. If total version is "1.2.0beta1", will be "beta1"

property.name: revision
property.description: The SVN rev from which dojo was pulled

object.description: provides timed callbacks using Java threads

method.name: debug

method.name: log
method.description: Sends arguments to console.

method.name: info
method.description: Sends arguments to console, highlighted with (I) icon.

method.name: warn
method.description: Sends warning arguments to console, highlighted with (!) icon and blue style.

method.name: error
method.description: Sends error arguments (object) to console, highlighted with (X) icon and yellow style NEW: error object now displays in object inspector

method.name: assert
method.description: Tests for true. Throws exception if false.

method.name: group
method.description: collects log messages into a group, starting with this call and ending with groupEnd(). Missing collapse functionality

method.name: groupEnd
method.description: Closes group. See above

method.name: time
method.description: Starts timers assigned to name given in argument. Timer stops and displays on timeEnd(title);

method.name: timeEnd
method.description: See above.

method.name: count
method.description: Not supported

method.name: trace
method.description: Not supported

method.name: profile
method.description: Not supported

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears message console. Do not call this directly

method.name: open
method.description: Opens message console. Do not call this directly

method.name: close
method.description: Closes message console. Do not call this directly

object.description: definitions for common key values

property.name: duration
property.description: The time in milliseonds the animation will take to run

property.name: curve
property.description: A two element array of start and end values, or a dojo._Line instance to be used in the Animation.

property.name: repeat
property.description: The number of times to loop the animation

property.name: rate
property.description: the time in milliseconds to wait before advancing to next frame (used as a fps timer: rate/1000 = fps)

property.name: delay
property.description: The time in milliseconds to wait before starting animation after it has been .play()'ed

property.name: beforeBegin
property.description: Event Synthetic event fired before a dojo._Animation begins playing (synchronous)

property.name: onBegin
property.description: Synthetic event fired as a dojo._Animation begins playing (useful?)

property.name: onAnimate
property.description: Synthetic event fired at each interval of a dojo._Animation

property.name: onEnd
property.description: Synthetic event fired after the final frame of a dojo._Animation

property.name: onPlay
property.description: Synthetic event fired any time a dojo._Animation is play()'ed

property.name: onPause
property.description: Synthetic event fired when a dojo._Animation is paused

property.name: onStop
property.description: Synthetic event fires when a dojo._Animation is stopped

method.name: easing
method.description: A Function to adjust the acceleration (or deceleration) of the progress across a dojo._Line

method.name: _fire
method.description: Convenience function. Fire event "evt" and pass it the arguments specified in "args".

parameter.name: evt
parameter.description: The event to fire.

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: The arguments to pass to the event.

method.name: play
method.description: Start the animation.

parameter.name: delay
parameter.description: How many milliseconds to delay before starting.

parameter.name: gotoStart
parameter.description: If true, starts the animation from the beginning; otherwise, starts it from its current position.

method.name: pause
method.description: Pauses a running animation.

method.name: gotoPercent
method.description: Sets the progress of the animation.

parameter.name: percent
parameter.description: A percentage in decimal notation (between and including 0.0 and 1.0).

parameter.name: andPlay
parameter.description: If true, play the animation after setting the progress.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops a running animation.

parameter.name: gotoEnd
parameter.description: If true, the animation will end.

method.name: status
method.description: Returns a string token representation of the status of the animation, one of: "paused", "playing", "stopped"
