object.description: Time Spinner

property.name: multiple
property.description: Matches the select's "multiple=" value

property.name: _multiValue
property.description: Whether or not we are multi-valued (for form)

method.name: getOptions
method.description: Returns a given option (or options).
method.return-description: The option corresponding with the given value or index. null is returned if any of the following are true: - A string value is passed in which doesn't exist - An index is passed in which is outside the bounds of the array of options - A dojox.form.__SelectOption is passed in which is not a part of the select NOTE: the compare for passing in a dojox.form.__SelectOption checks if the value property matches - NOT if the exact option exists NOTE: if passing in an array, null elements will be placed in the returned array when a value is not found.

parameter.name: valueOrIdx
parameter.description: If passed in as a string, that string is used to look up the option in the array of options - based on the value property. (See dojox.form.__SelectOption). If passed in a number, then the option with the given index (0-based) within this select will be returned. If passed in a dojox.form.__SelectOption, the same option will be returned if and only if it exists within this select. If passed an array, then an array will be returned with each element in the array being looked up. If not passed a value, then all options will be returned

method.name: addOption
method.description: Adds an option or options to the end of the select. If value of the option is empty or missing, a separator is created instead. Passing in an array of options will yeild slightly better performance since the children are only loaded once.

method.name: removeOption
method.description: Removes the given option or options. You can remove by string (in which case the value is removed), number (in which case the index in the options array is removed), or select option (in which case, the select option with a matching value is removed). You can also pass in an array of those values for a slightly better performance since the children are only loaded once.

method.name: updateOption
method.description: Updates the values of the given option. The option to update is matched based on the value of the entered option. Passing in an array of new options will yeild better performance since the children will only be loaded once.

method.name: _setValueAttr
method.description: set the value of the widget. If a string is passed, then we set our value from looking it up.

method.name: getValue
method.description: get the value of the widget.

method.name: undo
method.description: restore the value to the last value passed to onChange

method.name: _loadChildren
method.description: Loads the children represented by this widget's optiosn. reset the menu to make it "populatable on the next click

method.name: _updateSelection
method.description: Sets the "selected" class on the item for styling purposes

method.name: _getValueFromOpts
method.description: Returns the value of the widget by reading the options for the selected flag

method.name: _fillContent
method.description: Loads our options and sets up our dropdown correctly. We don't want any content, so we don't call any inherit chain function.

method.name: postCreate
method.description: sets up our event handling that we need for functioning as a select

method.description: User-overridable function which, for the given option, adds an item to the select. If the option doesn't have a value, then a separator is added in that place. Make sure to store the option in the created option widget.

object.description: Mixin for widgets that need drop down ability.

property.name: dropDownNode
property.description: responds to click events. "dropDownNode" can be set via a dojoAttachPoint assignment. If missing, then either focusNode or domNode (if focusNode is also missing) will be used.

property.name: popupStateNode
property.description: the node to set the popupActive class on. If missing, then focusNode or dropDownNode (if focusNode is missing) will be used.

property.name: aroundNode
property.description: the node to display the popup around. If missing, then domNode will be used.

property.name: dropDown
property.description: the widget to display in the popup. This widget *must* be defined before the startup function is called.

property.name: autoWidth
property.description: Set to true to make the drop down at least as wide as this widget. Set to false if the drop down should just be its default width

property.name: _stopClickEvents
property.description: When set to false, the click events will not be stopped, in case you want to use them in your subwidget

method.name: _onMenuMouseup
method.description: called with the mouseup event if the mouseup occurred over the menu. You can try and use this event in order to automatically execute your dropdown (as if it were clicked). You mightwant to close your menu as a part of this function.

method.name: _onDropDownMouse
method.description: callback when the user mouse clicks on menu popup node We handle mouse events using onmousedown in order to allow for selecting via a drag. So, our click is already handled, unless we are executed via keypress - in which case, this._seenKeydown will be set to true.

method.name: _onDropDownMouseup
method.description: callback when the user lifts their mouse - if we are over the menu, we execute it, otherwise, we focus our dropDown node. If the event is missing, then we are not a mouseup event.

method.name: _setupDropdown
method.description: set up nodes and connect our mouse and keypress events

method.name: _onKey
method.description: callback when the user presses a key on menu popup node

method.name: _onBlur
method.description: called magically when focus has shifted away from this widget and it's dropdown

method.name: isLoaded
method.description: returns whether or not the dropdown is loaded. This can be overridden in order to force a call to loadDropDown().

method.name: loadDropDown
method.description: loads the data for the dropdown, and at some point, calls the given callback

method.name: toggleDropDown
method.description: toggle the drop-down widget; if it is up, close it, if not, open it

method.name: openDropDown
method.description: opens the dropdown for this widget - it returns the return value of dijit.popup.open

method.name: closeDropDown
method.description: Closes the drop down on this widget

object.description: Mix this class in to a dojox.form._FormSelectWidget in order to provide support for "selectable" multiforms. The widget is pointed to a dijit.layout.StackContainer and will handle displaying and submitting the values of only the appropriate pane. The options for this widget will be automatically set - based on the panes that are in the stack container. The "title" attribute of the pane will be used for the display of the option. The "id" attribute of the pane will be used as the value of the option. In order to avoid running into unique ID constraint issues, a stackPrefix mechanism is provided.

property.name: stackPrefix
property.description: A prefix to remove from our stack pane ids when setting our options. This exists so that we won't run into unique ID constraints. For example, if stackPrefix is set to "foo_", and there are three panes in our stack with ids of "foo_a", "foo_b", and "foo_c", then the values of the options created for the stack controller widget will be "a", "b", and "c". This allows you to have multiple select stack widgets with the same values - without having to have the panes require the same ids.

method.name: _paneIdFromOption
method.description: Gets the pane ID given an option value

method.name: _optionValFromPane
method.description: Gets the option value given a pane ID

method.name: _togglePane
method.description: called when a pane is either shown or hidden (so that we can toggle the widgets on it)

method.name: onAddChild
method.description: Called when the stack container adds a new pane

method.name: onRemoveChild
method.description: Called when the stack container removes a pane

method.name: onSelectChild
method.description: Called when the stack container selects a new pane

method.name: onStartup
method.description: Called when the stack container is started up

method.name: onChange
method.description: Called when form select widget's value has changed

object.description: Extension animations to the core dojo FX project

property.name: scroll
property.description: Module to provide scroll-related FX

property.name: style
property.description: Module to provide CSS animations

method.name: sizeTo
method.description: Creates an animation that will size a node

method.name: slideBy
method.description: Returns an animation to slide a node by a defined offset.

method.name: crossFade
method.description: Returns an animation cross fading two element simultaneously

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.nodes Array - two element array of domNodes, or id's all other standard animation args mixins apply. args.node ignored.

method.name: highlight
method.description: Highlight a node
method.example: dojox.fx.highlight({ node:"foo" }).play();

method.name: wipeTo
method.description: Animate a node wiping to a specific width or height

method.name: flip
method.description: Animate a node flipping following a specific direction

method.name: flipCube
method.description: An extension to `dojox.fx.flip` providing a more 3d-like rotation
method.example: See `dojox.fx.flip`

method.name: smoothScroll
method.description: Returns an animation that will smooth-scroll to a node (specified in etup())

method.name: _split
method.description: Split a node into rectangular pieces and animate them.

parameter.name: args

method.name: explode
method.description: Explode a node into rectangular pieces

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.rows Integer - The number of horizontal pieces (default is 3) args.columns: Integer - The number of vertical pieces (default is 3) args.random: Float - If set, pieces fly to random distances, for random durations, and in slightly random directions. The value defines how much randomness is introduced. args.distance: Float - Multiplier for the distance the pieces fly (even when random) args.fade: Boolean - If true, pieces fade out while in motion (default is true) args.fadeEasing: Function - If args.fade is true, the fade animations use this easing function args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the animation is reversed args.sync: Boolean - If args.unhide is true, all the pieces converge at the same time (default is true)

method.name: disintegrate
method.description: Split a node into rectangular pieces and let them fall

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.rows Integer - The number of horizontal pieces (default is 5) args.columns: Integer - The number of vertical pieces (default is 5) args.interval: Float - The number of milliseconds between each piece's animation args.distance: Float - The number of the node's heights to drop (default is 1.5) args.fade: Boolean - If true, pieces fade out while in motion (default is true) args.random: Float - If set, pieces fall in random order. The value defines how much randomness is introduced. args.reverseOrder: Boolean - If true, pieces animate in reversed order args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the peices fall from above and land in place

method.name: shear
method.description: Split a node into rectangular pieces and slide them in alternating directions

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.rows Integer - The number of horizontal pieces (default is 6) args.columns: Integer - The number of vertical pieces (default is 6) args.interval: Float - The number of milliseconds between each piece's animation (default is 0) args.distance: Float - The multiple of the node's dimensions to slide (default is 1) args.fade: Boolean - If true, pieces fade out while in motion (default is true) args.random: Float - If true, pieces have a random delay. The value defines how much randomness is introduced args.reverseOrder: Boolean - If true, pieces animate in reversed order args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the animation is reversed

method.name: pinwheel
method.description: Split a node into rectangular pieces and wipe them in alternating directions

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.rows Integer - The number of horizontal pieces (default is 4) args.columns: Integer - The number of vertical pieces (default is 4) args.interval: Float - The number of milliseconds between each piece's animation (default is 0) args.distance: Float - The percentage of the piece's dimensions the piece should wipe args.fade: Boolean - If true, pieces fade out while in motion (default is true) args.random: Float - If true, pieces have a random delay. The value defines how much randomness is introduced. args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the animation is reversed

method.name: blockFadeOut
method.description: Split a node into rectangular pieces and fade them

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.rows Integer - The number of horizontal pieces (default is 5) args.columns: Integer - The number of vertical pieces (default is 5) args.interval: Float - The number of milliseconds between each piece's animation (default is 0) args.random: Float - If true, pieces have a random delay. The value defines how much randomness is introduced args.reverseOrder: Boolean - If true, pieces animate in reversed order args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the animation is reversed

method.name: resize

method.name: _split
method.description: Split a block of text into words or letters

parameter.name: args

method.name: explode
method.description: Explode a block of text into words or letters

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.crop Boolean - If true, pieces will be positioned relatively rather than absolutely args.words: Boolean - If true, text will be split into words rather than characters args.random: Float - If set, pieces fly to random distances, for random durations, and in slightly random directions. The value defines how much randomness is introduced. args.distance: Float - Multiplier for the distance the pieces fly (even when random) args.fade: Boolean - If true, pieces fade out while in motion (default is true) args.fadeEasing: Function - If args.fade is true, the fade animations use this easing function args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the animation is reversed args.sync: Boolean - If args.unhide is true, all the pieces converge at the same time (default is true)

method.name: disintegrate
method.description: Split a block of text into words or letters and let them fall

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.crop Boolean - If true, pieces will be positioned relatively rather than absolutely args.words: Boolean - If true, text will be split into words rather than characters args.interval: Float - The number of milliseconds between each piece's animation args.distance: Float - The number of the node's heights to drop (default is 1.5) args.fade: Boolean - If true, pieces fade out while in motion (default is true) args.random: Float - If set, pieces fall in random order. The value defines how much randomness is introduced args.reverseOrder: Boolean - If true, pieces animate in reversed order args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the peices fall from above and land in place

method.name: blockFadeOut
method.description: Split a block of text into words or letters and fade them

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.words Boolean - If true, text will be split into words rather than characters args.interval: Float - The number of milliseconds between each piece's animation (default is 0) args.random: Float - If true, pieces have a random delay. The value defines how much randomness is introduced args.reverseOrder: Boolean - If true, pieces animate in reversed order args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the animation is reversed

method.name: backspace
method.description: Split a block of text into words or letters and backspace them in sequence

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: args.interval Float - The number of milliseconds between each piece's animation (default is determined by text length and args.duration); args.wordDelay: Integer - The number of milliseconds between each word (only effective when args.unhide = true) args.fixed: Boolean - If true, only style.opacity changes; otherwise, style.display changes between none and inline, adding realism (default = false) args.random: Float - If true, pieces have a random delay. The value defines how much randomness is introduced (only effective when args.unhide = true) args.unhide: Boolean - If true, the animation is reversed

object.description: Create this font object based on the SVG Font definition at url.

method.name: draw

object.description: build the binary search tree, using binary space partition algorithm. The idea is for any polygon, for example, (a, b, c), the space is divided by the plane into two space: plus and minus. for any arbitary vertex p, if(p - a) dotProduct n = 0, p is inside the plane, > 0, p is in the plus space, vice versa for minus space. n is the normal vector that is perpendicular the plate, defined as: n = ( b - a) crossProduct ( c - a ) in this implementation, n is declared as normal, ,a is declared as orient.

parameter.description: horizontal distance from current focus

object.description: A grid widget with virtual scrolling, cell editing, complex rows, sorting, fixed columns, sizeable columns, etc.

property.name: classTag
property.description: CSS class applied to the grid's domNode

property.name: rowCount
property.description: Integer Number of rows to display.

property.name: keepRows
property.description: Number of rows to keep in the rendering cache.

property.name: rowsPerPage
property.description: Number of rows to render at a time.

property.name: autoWidth
property.description: If autoWidth is true, grid width is automatically set to fit the data.

property.name: autoHeight
property.description: If autoHeight is true, grid height is automatically set to fit the data. If it is an integer, the height will be automatically set to fit the data if there are fewer than that many rows - and the height will be set to show that many rows if there are more

property.name: autoRender
property.description: If autoRender is true, grid will render itself after initialization.

property.name: defaultHeight
property.description: default height of the grid, measured in any valid css unit.

property.name: height
property.description: explicit height of the grid, measured in any valid css unit. This will be populated (and overridden) if the height: css attribute exists on the source node.

property.name: structure
property.description: View layout defintion. Can be set to a layout object, or to the (string) name of a layout object.

property.name: elasticView
property.description: Override defaults and make the indexed grid view elastic, thus filling available horizontal space.

property.name: singleClickEdit
property.description: Single-click starts editing. Default is double-click

property.name: selectionMode
property.description: Set the selection mode of grid's Selection. Value must be 'single', 'multiple', or 'extended'. Default is 'extended'.

property.name: rowSelector
property.description: If set to true, will add a row selector view to this grid. If set to a CSS width, will add a row selector of that width to this grid.

property.name: columnReordering
property.description: If set to true, will add drag and drop reordering to views with one row of columns.

property.name: headerMenu
property.description: If set to a dijit.Menu, will use this as a context menu for the grid headers.

property.name: placeholderLabel
property.description: Label of placeholders to search for in the header menu to replace with column toggling menu items.

property.name: loadingMessage
property.description: Message that shows while the grid is loading

property.name: errorMessage
property.description: Message that shows when the grid encounters an error loading

property.name: noDataMessage
property.description: Message that shows if the grid has no data - wrap it in a span with class 'dojoxGridNoData' if you want it to be styled similar to the loading and error messages

property.name: fastScroll
property.description: flag modifies vertical scrolling behavior. Defaults to true but set to false for slower scroll performance but more immediate scrolling feedback

property.name: scrollRedrawThreshold
property.description: pixel distance a user must scroll vertically to trigger grid scrolling.

method.name: get
method.description: Default data getter.
method.return-description: Data to display for a given grid cell.

parameter.name: inRowIndex
parameter.description: Row for which to provide data

method.name: createManagers
method.description: create grid managers for various tasks including rows, focus, selection, editing

method.name: createScroller
method.description: Creates a new virtual scroller

method.name: createLayout
method.description: Creates a new Grid layout

method.name: setStructure
method.description: Install a new structure and rebuild the grid.

parameter.name: inStructure
parameter.description: Structure object defines the grid layout and provides various options for grid views and columns

method.name: resize
render
method.description: Render the grid, headers, and views. Edit and scrolling states are reset. To retain edit and scrolling states, see Update.

method.name: renderRow
method.description: private, used internally to render rows

method.name: rowRemoved
method.description: private, used internally to remove rows

method.name: beginUpdate
method.description: Use to make multiple changes to rows while queueing row updating. NOTE: not currently supporting nested begin/endUpdate calls

method.name: endUpdate
method.description: Use after calling beginUpdate to render any changes made to rows.

method.name: update
method.description: Update the grid, retaining edit and scrolling states.

method.name: updateRow
method.description: Render a single row.

parameter.name: inRowIndex
parameter.description: Index of the row to render

method.name: updateRows
method.description: Render consecutive rows at once.

parameter.name: startIndex
parameter.description: Index of the starting row to render

parameter.name: howMany
parameter.description: How many rows to update.

method.name: updateRowCount
method.description: Change the number of rows.

parameter.name: inRowCount
parameter.description: Number of rows in the grid.

method.name: updateRowStyles
method.description: Update the styles for a row after it's state has changed.

method.name: rowHeightChanged
method.description: Update grid when the height of a row has changed. Row height is handled automatically as rows are rendered. Use this function only to update a row's height outside the normal rendering process.

parameter.name: inRowIndex
parameter.description: index of the row that has changed height

method.name: scrollTo
method.description: Vertically scroll the grid to a given pixel position

parameter.name: inTop
parameter.description: vertical position of the grid in pixels

method.name: scrollToRow
method.description: Scroll the grid to a specific row.

parameter.name: inRowIndex
parameter.description: grid row index

method.name: getCell
method.description: Retrieves the cell object for a given grid column.
method.return-description: a grid cell

parameter.name: inIndex
parameter.description: Grid column index of cell to retrieve

method.name: getCellName
method.description: Returns the cell name of a passed cell

method.name: canSort
method.description: Determines if the grid can be sorted
method.return-description: Boolean True if grid can be sorted on the given column in the given direction

parameter.name: inSortInfo
parameter.description: Sort information, 1-based index of column on which to sort, positive for an ascending sort and negative for a descending sort

method.name: getSortAsc
method.description: Returns true if grid is sorted in an ascending direction.

method.name: getSortIndex
method.description: Returns the index of the column on which the grid is sorted

method.name: setSortIndex
method.description: Sort the grid on a column in a specified direction

parameter.name: inIndex
parameter.description: Column index on which to sort.

parameter.name: inAsc
parameter.description: If true, sort the grid in ascending order, otherwise in descending order

method.name: addRow
method.description: Add a row to the grid.

method.name: removeSelectedRows
method.description: Remove the selected rows from the grid.

object.description: Controls grid cell layout. Owned by grid and used internally.
Custom grid view. If used in a grid structure, provides a small selectable region for grid rows.

A collection of grid columns. A grid is comprised of a set of views that stack horizontally. Grid creates views automatically based on grid's layout structure. Users should typically not need to access individual views directly.

property.description: Default width of the view

property.description: Width for the view, in valid css unit

property.name: _togglingColumn
property.description: Width of the column being toggled (-1 for none)

parameter.description: The string-representation of a namespace.

parameter.description: Whether to recurse through the namespace.

method.description: Use this function when you want to resolve the problems created by including a dojox.help package.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: If you pass an item, only that item will be cleaned

method.description: Should be called by one of the implementations. Runs startup code

parameter.name: namespaces
parameter.description: Any namespaces to add to the default (dojox.help._namespaces)

parameter.description: Whether to start in noConflict mode

object.description: A client-side syntax highlighting engine.

method.name: _adjustCssPaths
method.description: adjusts relative paths in cssText to be relative to cssUrl a path is considered relative if it doesn't start with '/' and not contains ':'

method.name: set
method.description: TODO: add all the other options inserts (replaces) the given content into the given node

parameter.name: node
parameter.description: the parent element that will receive the content

parameter.name: cont
parameter.description: the content to be set on the parent element. This can be an html string, a node reference or a NodeList, dojo.NodeList, Array or other enumerable list of nodes

parameter.name: params
parameter.description: Optional flags/properties to configure the content-setting. See dojo.html._ContentSetter

parameter.name: selector
parameter.description: Creates a style and attaches it to a dynamically created stylesheet arguments: A fully qualified class name, as it would appear in a CSS dojo.doc. Start classes with periods, target nodes with '#'. Large selectors can also be created like: "#myDiv.myClass span input"

parameter.name: declaration
parameter.description: single string that would make up a style block, not including the curly braces. Include semi-colons between statements. Do not use JavaScript style declarations in camel case, use as you would in a CSS dojo.doc: "color:#ffoooo;font-size:12px;margin-left:5px;"

parameter.name: styleSheetName
parameter.description: ) Name of the dynamic style sheet this rule should be inserted into. If is not found by that name, it is created. If no name is passed, the name "default" is used.

method.name: getToggledStyleSheets
method.return-description: summary Searches HTML for style sheets that are "toggle-able" - can be enabled and disabled. These would include sheets with the title attribute, as well as the REL attribute. An array of all toggle-able style sheets TODO: Sets of style sheets could be grouped according to an ID and used in sets, much like different groups of radio buttons. It would not however be according to W3C spec

method.name: getStyleSheets
method.return-description: summary Collects all the style sheets referenced in the HTML page, including any incuded via @import. An hash map of all the style sheets. TODO: Does not recursively search for @imports, so it will only go one level deep.

property.name: adjustPaths
property.description: Adjust relative paths in html string content to point to this page Only useful if you grab content from a another folder than the current one

object.description: Gallery widget that wraps a dojox.image.ThumbnailPicker and dojox.image.SlideShow widget

property.name: imageHeight
property.description: Maximum height of an image in the SlideShow widget

property.name: imageWidth
property.description: Maximum width of an image in the SlideShow widget

property.name: pageSize
property.description: The number of records to retrieve from the data store per request.

property.name: autoLoad
property.description: If true, images are loaded before the user views them. If false, an image is loaded when the user displays it.

property.name: linkAttr
property.description: Defines the name of the attribute to request from the store to retrieve the URL to link to from an image, if any.

property.name: imageThumbAttr
property.description: Defines the name of the attribute to request from the store to retrieve the URL to the thumbnail image.

property.name: imageLargeAttr
property.description: Defines the name of the attribute to request from the store to retrieve the URL to the image.

property.name: titleAttr
property.description: Defines the name of the attribute to request from the store to retrieve the title of the picture, if any.

property.name: slideshowInterval
property.description: time in seconds, between image changes in the slide show.

method.name: postCreate
method.description: Initializes the widget, creates the ThumbnailPicker and SlideShow widgets

method.name: setDataStore
method.description: Sets the data store and request objects to read data from.

parameter.name: dataStore
parameter.description: implementation of the dojo.data.api.Read API. This accesses the image data.

parameter.name: request
parameter.description: implementation of the dojo.data.api.Request API. This specifies the query and paging information to be used by the data store

parameter.name: paramNames
parameter.description: An object defining the names of the item attributes to fetch from the data store. The four attributes allowed are 'linkAttr', 'imageLargeAttr', 'imageThumbAttr' and 'titleAttr'

method.name: reset
method.description: Resets the widget to its initial state

method.name: showNextImage
method.description: Changes the image being displayed in the SlideShow to the next image in the data store

parameter.name: inTimer
parameter.description: If true, a slideshow is active, otherwise the slideshow is inactive.

method.name: toggleSlideshow
method.description: Switches the slideshow mode on and off.

method.name: showImage
method.description: Shows the image at index 'idx'. idx: Number The position of the image in the data store to display

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: Function Optional callback function to call when the image has finished displaying.

method.name: _centerChildren
method.description: Ensures that the ThumbnailPicker and the SlideShow widgets are centered.

object.description: A dojo-based Lightbox implementation.

property.name: _allowPassthru
property.description: Privately set this to disable/enable natural link of anchor tags

method.name: _addSelf
method.description: Add this instance to the master LightBoxDialog

method.name: _handleClick
method.description: Handle the click on the link

method.name: show
method.description: Show the Lightbox with this instance as the starting point

method.name: disable
method.description: Disables event clobbering and dialog, and follows natural link

method.name: enable
method.description: Enables the dialog (prevents default link)

object.description: The "dialog" shared between any Lightbox instances on the page, publically available for programatic manipulation.

property.name: title
property.description: The current title, read from object passed to show()

property.name: imgUrl
property.description: The src="" attribute of our imageNode (can be null at statup)

property.name: errorMessage
property.description: The text to display when an unreachable image is linked

property.name: adjust
property.description: If true, ensure the image always stays within the viewport more difficult than necessary to disable, but enabled by default seems sane in most use cases.

property.name: errorImg
property.description: Path to the image used when a 404 is encountered

method.name: startup

object.description: A Slideshow Widget

property.name: imageWidth
property.description: The maximum width of an image.

property.name: title
property.description: the initial title of the SlideShow

property.name: titleTemplate
property.description: a way to customize the wording in the title. supported parameters to be populated are: ${title} = the passed title of the image ${current} = the current index of the image ${total} = the total number of images in the SlideShow should add more?

property.name: noLink
property.description: Prevents the slideshow from putting an anchor link around the displayed image enables if true, though still will not link in absence of a url to link to

property.name: loop
property.description: true/false - make the slideshow loop

property.description: toggle to enable/disable the visual navigation controls

property.name: images
property.description: Contains the DOM nodes that individual images are stored in when loaded or loading.

property.name: pageSize
property.description: The number of images to request each time.

property.name: autoLoad
property.description: If true, then images are preloaded, before the user navigates to view them. If false, an image is not loaded until the user views it.

property.name: autoStart
property.description: If true, the SlideShow begins playing immediately

property.name: fixedHeight
property.description: If true, the widget does not resize itself to fix the displayed image.

property.description: Implementation of the dojo.data.api.Read API, which provides data on the images to be displayed.

property.description: Defines the name of the attribute to request from the store to retrieve the URL to link to from an image, if any.

property.name: imageLargeAttr
property.description: Defines the name of the attribute to request from the store to retrieve the URL to the image.

property.name: titleAttr
property.description: Defines the name of the attribute to request from the store to retrieve the title of the picture, if any.

property.name: slideshowInterval
property.description: Time, in seconds, between image transitions during a slideshow.

property.name: _imageCounter
property.description: A counter to keep track of which index image is to be loaded next

property.name: _tmpImage
property.description: The temporary image to show when a picture is loading.

parameter.description: An object defining the names of the item attributes to fetch from the data store. The three attributes allowed are 'linkAttr', 'imageLargeAttr' and 'titleAttr'

Implementation of the dojo.data.api.Request API, which defines the query parameters for accessing the store.
A scrolling Thumbnail Picker widget

property.name: imageStore
property.description: A data store that implements the dojo.data Read API.

property.name: size
property.description: Width or height in pixels, depending if horizontal or vertical.

property.name: thumbHeight
property.description: Default height of a thumbnail image

property.name: thumbWidth
property.description: Default width of an image

property.name: useLoadNotifier
property.description: Setting useLoadNotifier to true makes a colored DIV appear under each thumbnail image, which is used to display the loading status of each image in the data store.

property.name: useHyperlink
property.description: Setting useHyperlink to true causes a click on a thumbnail to open a link.

property.name: hyperlinkTarget
property.description: If hyperlinkTarget is set to "new", clicking on a thumb will open a new window If it is set to anything else, clicking a thumbnail will open the url in the current window.

property.name: isClickable
property.description: When set to true, the cursor over a thumbnail changes.

property.name: isScrollable
property.description: When true, uses smoothScroll to move between pages

property.name: isHorizontal
property.description: If true, the thumbnails are displayed horizontally. Otherwise they are displayed vertically

property.name: linkAttr
property.description: The attribute name for accessing the url from the data store

property.name: imageThumbAttr
property.description: The attribute name for accessing the thumbnail image url from the data store

property.name: imageLargeAttr
property.description: The attribute name for accessing the large image url from the data store

property.name: pageSize
property.description: The number of images to request each time.

property.name: titleAttr
property.description: The attribute name for accessing the title from the data store

property.name: _thumbIndex
property.description: The index of the first thumbnail shown

property.name: _maxPhotos
property.description: The total number of photos in the image store

property.name: _loadedImages
property.description: Stores the indices of images that have been marked as loaded using the markImageLoaded function.

method.name: httpParse
method.description: Parses an HTTP stream for a message.

parameter.name: httpStream
parameter.description: HTTP stream to parse

parameter.name: topHeaders
parameter.description: Extra header information to add to each HTTP request (kind of HTTP inheritance)

parameter.name: partial
parameter.description: A true value indicates that the stream may not be finished, it may end arbitrarily in mid stream. The last XHR object will have a special property _lastIndex that indicates the how far along the httpStream could be successfully parsed into HTTP messages. return: Returns an array of XHR-like object for reading the headers for each message

method.name: xhrWindowNamePlugin
method.description: Adds the windowName transport as an XHR plugin for the given site. See dojox.io.windowName for more information on the transport.

parameter.name: httpAdapter
parameter.description: This allows for adapting HTTP requests that could not otherwise be sent with XDR, so you can use a convention for headers and PUT/DELETE methods.

method.description: HTML5 document messaging endpoint. Unpack the event to see if we want to use it.

method.description: All the properties described in the dojo.__ioArgs type, apply to this type as well, EXCEPT "handleAs". It is not applicable to dojo.io.script.get() calls, since it is implied by the usage of "callbackParamName" (response will be a JSONP call returning JSON) or "checkString" (response is pure JavaScript defined in the body of the script that was attached).

method.name: get
method.description: sends a get request using a dynamically created script tag.

method.name: attach
method.description: creates a new <script> tag pointing to the specified URL and adds it to the document.

method.name: remove
method.description: removes the script element with the given id, from the given frameDocument. If no frameDocument is passed, the current document is used.

method.name: _deferredError
method.description: errHandler function for dojo._ioSetArgs call.

method.name: _addDeadScript

method.name: _validCheck
method.description: inflight check function to see if dfd is still valid.

method.name: _ioCheck
method.description: inflight check function to see if IO finished.

method.name: _resHandle
method.description: inflight function to handle a completed response.

method.name: _fixAttachUrl
method.description: fixes the URL so that

method.name: _loaded
method.description: callback used when waiting for a frame to load (related to the usage of the frameId argument to dojo.io.script.get().

method.name: send
method.description: Provides secure cross-domain request capability. Sends a request using an iframe (POST or GET) and reads the response through the frame's window.name.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: The method to use to send the request, GET or POST

parameter.name: args
parameter.description: See dojo.xhr args.authElement: DOMNode? By providing an authElement, this indicates that windowName should use the authorized window.name protocol, relying on the loaded XD resource to return to the provided return URL on completion of authorization/authentication. The provided authElement will be used to place the iframe in, so the user can interact with the server resource for authentication and/or authorization to access the resource. args.onAuthLoad: Function? When using authorized access to resources, this function will be called when the authorization page has been loaded. (When authorization is actually completed, the deferred callback function is called with the result). The primary use for this is to make the authElement visible to the user once the resource has loaded (this can be preferable to showing the iframe while the resource is loading since it may not require authorization, it may simply return the resource).

method.name: register
method.description: overrides the default xhr handler to implement a registry of xhr handlers

return-type.type: or check to see if we have the same path

method.name: addProxy
method.description: adds a server side proxy xhr handler for cross-site URLs

parameter.name: proxyUrl
parameter.description: is URL to send the requests to.

method.name: addCrossSiteXhr
method.description: Adds W3C Cross site XHR or XDomainRequest handling for the given URL prefix

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: that start with this URL will be considered for using cross-site XHR.

parameter.name: httpAdapter
parameter.description: allows for adapting HTTP requests that could not otherwise be sent with XDR, so you can use a convention for headers and PUT/DELETE methods.

method.name: fullHttpAdapter
method.description: Provides a HTTP adaption.
method.example: dojox.io.xhrPlugins.addXdr("http://somesite.com", dojox.io.xhrPlugins.fullHttpAdapter);

method.name: query
method.description: Performs a JSONQuery on the provided object and returns the results. If no object is provided (just a query), it returns a "compiled" function that evaluates objects according to the provided query.

parameter.name: query
parameter.description: Query string

parameter.name: obj
parameter.description: Target of the JSONQuery

return-type.type: we mark all the inner brackets as skippable
FIXME: Should check to make sure the $obj token isn't followed by characters

method.example: dojox.json.query("foo",{foo:"bar"}) This will return "bar".

method.name: validate
method.description: To use the validator call this with an instance object and an optional schema object. If a schema is provided, it will be used to validate. If the instance object refers to a schema (self-validating), that schema will be used to validate and the schema parameter is not necessary (if both exist, both validations will occur).

parameter.name: instance
parameter.description: The instance value/object to validate

parameter.name: schema
parameter.description: The schema to use to validate

method.name: checkPropertyChange
method.description: The checkPropertyChange method will check to see if an value can legally be in property with the given schema This is slightly different than the validate method in that it will fail if the schema is readonly and it will not check for self-validation, it is assumed that the passed in value is already internally valid. The checkPropertyChange method will return the same object type as validate, see JSONSchema.validate for information.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The new instance value/object to check

parameter.name: schema

object.description: A query system for JavaScript objects

return-type.type: if it is result based, there is no point to just return the same array

method.name: cflow
method.description: Returns true if the context stack contains a context for a given instance that satisfies a given method name criteria.

parameter.name: instance
parameter.description: An instance to be matched. If null, any context will be examined. Otherwise the context should belong to this instance.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: An optional pattern to be matched against a method name. Can be a string, a RegExp object or an array of strings and RegExp objects. If it is omitted, any name will satisfy the criteria.

method.name: counter
method.description: Returns an object, which can be used to count calls to methods.

method.name: memoizer
method.description: Returns an object, which can be used to count calls to methods.

parameter.name: keyMaker
parameter.description: the function, which takes method's arguments and returns a key, which can be used to index the result.

method.name: tracer
method.description: Returns an object, which can be used to trace calls with Firebug's console. Prints argument, a return value, or an exception.

parameter.name: grouping
parameter.description: The flag to group output. If true, indents embedded console messages.

object.description: Language specific extensions

method.name: observable
method.description: Creates a wrapper object, which can be observed. The wrapper object is a proxy to the wrapped object. If you will be making multiple wrapper objects with the same set of listeners, it is recommended that you use makeObservable, as it is more memory efficient.

parameter.name: wrapped
parameter.description: The object to be wrapped and monitored for property access and modification

parameter.name: onRead
parameter.description: See dojox.lang.makeObservable.onRead

parameter.name: onWrite
parameter.description: See dojox.lang.makeObservable.onWrite

parameter.name: onInvoke
parameter.description: See dojox.lang.makeObservable.onInvoke

method.name: makeObservable
method.description: Creates and returns an observable creator function. All the objects that are created with the returned constructor will use the provided onRead and onWrite listeners. The created constructor should be called with a single argument, the object that will be wrapped to be observed. The constructor will return the wrapper object.

parameter.name: onRead
parameter.description: This is called whenever one of the wrapper objects created from the constructor has a property that is accessed. onRead will be called with two arguments, the first being the wrapped object, and the second is the name of property that is being accessed. The value that onRead returns will be used as the value returned by the property access

parameter.name: onWrite
parameter.description: This is called whenever one of the wrapper objects created from the constructor has a property that is modified. onWrite will be called with three arguments, the first being the wrapped object, the second is the name of property that is being modified, and the third is the value that is being set on the property.

parameter.name: onInvoke
parameter.description: This is called when a method on the object is invoked. The first argument is the wrapper object, the second is the original wrapped object, the third is the method name, and the fourth is the arguments.

parameter.name: hiddenFunctions
parameter.description: allows you to define functions that should be delegated but may not be enumerable on the wrapped objects, so they must be explicitly included

return-type.type: the class can't be accessed, only called, so we have to wrap it with a function
do it with getters and setters

Pane 1!
Pane 2!

A collection of various advanced math functions.
the Dojo Offline project

method.name: onLoad
method.description: Called when Dojo Offline can be used.

method.name: onNetwork
method.description: Called when our on- or offline- status changes.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Either "online" or "offline".

method.name: initialize
method.description: void Called when a Dojo Offline-enabled application is finished configuring Dojo Offline, and is ready for Dojo Offline to initialize itself.

method.name: goOffline
method.description: void For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Manually goes offline, away from the network.

method.name: goOnline
method.description: void For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Attempts to go online.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: An optional callback function that will receive one argument: whether the site is available or not and is boolean. If this function is not present we call dojo.xoff.onOnline instead if we are able to go online. console.debug("goOnline");

method.name: onFrameworkEvent
method.description: For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. A standard event handler that can be attached to to find out about low-level framework events. Most developers will not need to attach to this method; it is meant for low-level information that can be useful for updating offline user-interfaces in exceptional circumstances. The default Dojo Offline UI widget takes care of most of these situations.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the event: * "offlineCacheInstalled" An event that is fired when a user has installed an offline cache after the page has been loaded. If a user didn't have an offline cache when the page loaded, a UI of some kind might have prompted them to download one. This method is called if they have downloaded and installed an offline cache so a UI can reinitialize itself to begin using this offline cache. * "coreOperationFailed" Fired when a core operation during interaction with the offline cache is denied by the user. Some offline caches, such as Google Gears, prompts the user to approve or deny caching files, using the database, and more. If the user denies a request that is core to Dojo Offline's operation, we set dojox.off.coreOpFailed to true and call this method for listeners that would like to respond some how to Dojo Offline 'failing fast'. * "save" Called whenever the framework saves data into persistent storage. This could be useful for providing save feedback or providing appropriate error feedback if saving fails due to a user not allowing the save to occur

parameter.name: saveData
parameter.description: If the type was 'save', then a saveData object is provided with further save information. This object has the following properties: * status - dojox.storage.SUCCESS, dojox.storage.PENDING, dojox.storage.FAILED Whether the save succeeded, whether it is pending based on a UI dialog asking the user for permission, or whether it failed. * isCoreSave - boolean If true, then this save was for a core piece of data necessary for the functioning of Dojo Offline. If false, then it is a piece of normal data being saved for offline access. Dojo Offline will 'fail fast' if some core piece of data could not be saved, automatically setting dojox.off.coreOpFailed to 'true' and dojox.off.enabled to 'false'. * key - String The key that we are attempting to persist * value - Object The object we are trying to persist * namespace - String The Dojo Storage namespace we are saving this key/value pair into, such as "default", "Documents", "Contacts", etc. Optional.

method.name: _isSiteAvailable
method.description: Determines if our web application's website is available.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: An optional callback function that will receive one argument: whether the site is available or not and is boolean. If this function is not present we call dojox.off.onNetwork instead if we are able to go online.

method.name: _save
method.description: Causes the Dojo Offline framework to save its configuration data into local storage.

method.name: _load
method.description: Causes the Dojo Offline framework to load its configuration data from local storage

property.name: versionURL
property.description: An optional file, that if present, records the version of our bundle of files to make available offline. If this file is present, and we are not currently debugging, then we only refresh our offline files if the version has changed.

property.name: listOfURLs
property.description: For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Our list of URLs that will be cached and made available offline.

property.name: refreshing
property.description: For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Whether we are currently in the middle of refreshing our list of offline files.

method.name: slurp
cache
method.description: void Caches a file or list of files to be available offline. This can either be a full URL, such as http://foobar.com/index.html, or a relative URL, such as ../index.html. This URL is not actually cached until dojox.off.sync.synchronize() is called.

parameter.name: urlOrList
parameter.description: or Array[] A URL of a file to cache or an Array of Strings of files to cache console.debug("dojox.off.files.cache, urlOrList="+urlOrList);

method.name: printURLs
method.description: A helper function that will dump and print out all of the URLs that are cached for offline availability. This can help with debugging if you are trying to make sure that all of your URLs are available offline

method.name: remove
method.description: void Removes a URL from the list of files to cache.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The URL to remove

method.name: isAvailable
method.description: boolean Determines whether the given resource is available offline.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: The URL to check

method.name: refresh
method.description: void console.debug("dojox.off.files.refresh"); For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Refreshes our list of offline resources, making them available offline.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: A callback that receives two arguments: whether an error occurred, which is a boolean; and an array of error message strings with details on errors encountered. If no error occured then message is empty array with length 0.

method.name: abortRefresh
method.description: For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Aborts and cancels a refresh.

method.name: synchronize
method.description: void Starts synchronizing

method.name: cancel
method.description: void Attempts to cancel this sync session

method.name: finishedDownloading
method.description: Applications call this method from their after getting a "download" event in dojox.off.sync.onSync to signal that they are finished downloading any data that should be available offline

parameter.name: successful
parameter.description: Whether our downloading was successful or not. If not present, defaults to true.

parameter.name: errorMessage
parameter.description: If unsuccessful, a message explaining why

method.name: start
method.description: void For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Called at the start of the syncing process. Advanced developers can over-ride this method to use their own sync mechanism to start syncing.

method.name: refreshFiles
method.description: void For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Called when we are going to refresh our list of offline files during syncing. Advanced developers can over-ride this method to do some advanced magic related to refreshing files. dojo.debug("refreshFiles");

method.name: upload
method.description: void For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Called when syncing wants to upload data. Advanced developers can over-ride this method to completely throw away the Action Log and replaying system and roll their own advanced sync mechanism if needed.

method.name: download
method.description: void For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Called when syncing wants to download data. Advanced developers can over-ride this method to use their own sync mechanism.

method.name: finished
method.description: void For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Called when syncing is finished. Advanced developers can over-ride this method to clean up after finishing their own sync mechanism they might have rolled.

property.name: entries
property.description: An array of our action entries, where each one is simply a custom object literal that were passed to add() when this action entry was added.

property.name: reasonHalted
property.description: If we halted, the reason why

property.name: isReplaying
property.description: If true, we are in the middle of replaying a command log; if false, then we are not

property.name: autoSave
property.description: Whether we automatically save the action log after each call to add(); defaults to true. For applications that are rapidly adding many action log entries in a short period of time, it can be useful to set this to false and simply call save() yourself when you are ready to persist your command log -- otherwise performance could be slow as the default action is to attempt to persist the actions log constantly with calls to add().

method.name: add
method.description: void Adds an action to our action log

method.name: onReplay
method.description: void Called when we replay our log, for each of our action entries.

parameter.name: action
actionLog
parameter.description: A reference to the dojox.off.sync.actions log so that developers can easily call actionLog.continueReplay() or actionLog.haltReplay().

method.name: length
method.description: Number Returns the length of this action log

method.name: haltReplay
method.description: void Halts replaying this command log.

parameter.name: reason
parameter.description: The reason we halted.

method.name: continueReplay
method.description: void Indicates that we should continue processing out list of actions.

method.name: clear
method.description: void Completely clears this action log of its entries

method.name: replay
method.description: void For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Replays all of the commands that have been cached in this command log when we go back online; onCommand will be called for each command we have

method.name: onReplayFinished
method.description: For advanced usage; most developers can ignore this. Called when we are finished replaying our commands; called if we have successfully exhausted all of our commands, or if an error occurred during replaying. The default implementation simply continues the synchronization process. Connect to this to register for the event: dojo.connect(dojox.off.sync.actions, "onReplayFinished", someFunc)

method.name: onLoad
method.description: A function that should be connected to allow your application to know when Dojo Offline, the page, and the Offline Widget are all initialized and ready to be used: dojo.connect(dojox.off.ui, "onLoad", someFunc)

method.name: _onNetwork
method.description: Called when we go on- or off-line

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: "online" if we just moved online, and "offline" if we just moved offline.

object.description: Additional input validation methods

property.name: creditCard
property.description: Validate various credit card types

method.name: isText
method.description: Checks if a string has non whitespace characters. Parameters allow you to constrain the length.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: A string

parameter.name: flags
parameter.description: length Number, minlength: Number, maxlength: Number} flags.length If set, checks if there are exactly flags.length number of characters. flags.minlength If set, checks if there are at least flags.minlength number of characters. flags.maxlength If set, checks if there are at most flags.maxlength number of characters.

method.name: isInRange
method.description: Validates whether a string denoting a number is between a max and min.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: A string

parameter.name: flags
parameter.description: max:Number min:Number, decimal:String} flags.max A number, which the value must be less than or equal to for the validation to be true. flags.min A number, which the value must be greater than or equal to for the validation to be true. flags.decimal The character used for the decimal point. Default is ".". fixes ticket #2908

method.name: isNumberFormat
method.description: Validates any sort of number based format

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: A string

parameter.name: flags
parameter.description: format:String flags.format A string or an Array of strings for multiple formats.

method.name: commit

method.name: changing

method.name: deleteObject

parameter.name: object
parameter.description: to delete

method.name: getConstructor
method.description: Creates or gets a constructor for objects from this service

method.name: fetch

method.name: getIdAttribute
method.description: Return the ids attribute used by this service (based on it's schema). Defaults to "id", if not other id is defined

method.description: Returns the REST service and the local id for the given absolute id. The result is returned as an object with a service property and an id property

return-type.type: if it is not found we have to just return the error
server error, let the error propagate

method.name: addStore
method.description: Adds a store to the monitored store for local storage

parameter.name: store

parameter.name: baseQuery
parameter.description: This is the base query to should be used to load the items for the store. Generally you want to load all the items that should be available when offline.

object.description: Take a string as a url to retrieve an smd or an object that is an smd or partial smd to use as a definition for the service

return-type.type: serialize with the right schema for the context;

method.name: sandbox
method.description: Creates a secure sandbox from which scripts and HTML can be loaded that will only be able to access the provided element and it's descendants, the rest of the DOM and JS environment will not be accessible to the sandboxed scripts and HTML.

parameter.name: element
parameter.description: DOM element to use as the container for the sandbox

method.name: validate
method.description: pass in the text of a script. If it passes and it can be eval'ed, it should be safe. Note that this does not do full syntax checking, it relies on eval to reject invalid scripts. There are also known false rejections: Nesting vars inside blocks will not declare the variable for the outer block Named functions are not treated as declaration so they are generally not allowed unless the name is declared with a var. Var declaration that involve multiple comma delimited variable assignments are not accepted

parameter.name: script
parameter.description: the script to execute

parameter.name: safeLibraries
parameter.description: The safe libraries that can be called (the functions can not be access/modified by the untrusted code, only called)

parameter.name: safeGlobals
parameter.description: These globals can be freely interacted with by the untrusted code

return-type.type: comments are replaced with a space, strings and regex are replaced with a single safe token (0)
replace literal keys with 0: and replace properties with the innocuous ~
the whitelist for [ operator for array initializer context or [+num] syntax
turn into a known safe call
return a block reference so the outer block can fetch it

method.name: loadJS
method.description: Loads the script from the given URL using XHR (assuming a plugin system is in place for cross-site requests) within the sandbox

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: url of the script to load

method.name: loadHTML
method.description: Loads the web page from the provided URL using XHR (assuming the plugin system is in place) within the sandbox. All scripts within the web page will also be sandboxed.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: url of the web page to load

method.name: evaluate
method.description: Evaluates the given script within the sandbox

parameter.name: script
parameter.description: JavaScript text to evaluate

object.description: A private class encapsulating any cryptography that must be done on a SQL statement. We instantiate this class and have it hold it's state so that we can potentially have several encryption operations happening at the same time by different SQL statements.

method.name: encrypt
method.description: Use Corrected Block TEA to encrypt plaintext using password (note plaintext & password must be strings not string objects). Results will be returned to the 'callback' asychronously.

method.name: decrypt
method.description: Use Corrected Block TEA to decrypt ciphertext using password (note ciphertext & password must be strings not string objects). Results will be returned to the 'callback' asychronously.

return-type.type: convert state to 1-d array before returning [3.4]

object.description: Objects for mass storage within the browser. For when cookies just aren't enough.
Storage provider that uses the features of Google Gears to store data (it is saved into the local SQL database provided by Gears, using dojox.sql)
A singleton for working with dojox.storage.

property.name: SUCCESS
property.description: Flag that indicates a put() call to a storage provider was succesful.

property.name: FAILED
property.description: Flag that indicates a put() call to a storage provider failed.

property.name: PENDING
property.description: Flag that indicates a put() call to a storage provider is pending user approval.

property.name: SIZE_NOT_AVAILABLE
property.description: Returned by getMaximumSize() if this storage provider can not determine the maximum amount of data it can support.

property.name: SIZE_NO_LIMIT
property.description: Returned by getMaximumSize() if this storage provider has no theoretical limit on the amount of data it can store.

property.name: DEFAULT_NAMESPACE
property.description: The namespace for all storage operations. This is useful if several applications want access to the storage system from the same domain but want different storage silos.

method.name: onHideSettingsUI
method.description: If a function is assigned to this property, then when the settings provider's UI is closed this function is called. Useful, for example, if the user has just cleared out all storage for this provider using the settings UI, and you want to update your UI.

method.name: initialize
method.description: Allows this storage provider to initialize itself. This is called after the page has finished loading, so you can not do document.writes(). Storage Provider subclasses should initialize themselves inside of here rather than in their function constructor.

method.name: isAvailable
method.description: Boolean Returns whether this storage provider is available on this platform.

method.name: put
method.description: Puts a key and value into this storage system.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: A string key to use when retrieving this value in the future.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: A value to store; this can be any JavaScript type.

parameter.name: resultsHandler
parameter.description: A callback function that will receive three arguments. The first argument is one of three values: dojox.storage.SUCCESS, dojox.storage.FAILED, or dojox.storage.PENDING; these values determine how the put request went. In some storage systems users can deny a storage request, resulting in a dojox.storage.FAILED, while in other storage systems a storage request must wait for user approval, resulting in a dojox.storage.PENDING status until the request is either approved or denied, resulting in another call back with dojox.storage.SUCCESS. The second argument in the call back is the key name that was being stored. The third argument in the call back is an optional message that details possible error messages that might have occurred during the storage process.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.description: Optional string namespace that this value will be placed into; if left off, the value will be placed into dojox.storage.DEFAULT_NAMESPACE

method.name: get
method.description: Object Gets the value with the given key. Returns null if this key is not in the storage system.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: A string key to get the value of.

parameter.name: namespace

method.name: hasKey
method.description: Determines whether the storage has the given key.

method.name: getKeys
method.description: Array Enumerates all of the available keys in this storage system. return: Array of available keys

method.name: clear
method.description: Completely clears this storage system of all of it's values and keys. If 'namespace' is provided just clears the keys in that namespace.

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes the given key from this storage system.

method.name: isPermanent
method.description: Boolean Returns whether this storage provider's values are persisted when this platform is shutdown.

method.name: getMaximumSize
method.description: mixed The maximum storage allowed by this provider
method.return-description: Returns the maximum storage size supported by this provider, in thousands of bytes (i.e., if it returns 60 then this means that 60K of storage is supported). If this provider can not determine it's maximum size, then dojox.storage.SIZE_NOT_AVAILABLE is returned; if there is no theoretical limit on the amount of storage this provider can return, then dojox.storage.SIZE_NO_LIMIT is returned

method.name: putMultiple
method.description: Puts multiple keys and values into this storage system.

parameter.name: keys
parameter.description: An array of string keys to use when retrieving this value in the future, one per value to be stored

parameter.name: values
parameter.description: An array of values to store; this can be any JavaScript type, though the performance of plain strings is considerably better

parameter.name: resultsHandler
parameter.description: A callback function that will receive three arguments. The first argument is one of three values: dojox.storage.SUCCESS, dojox.storage.FAILED, or dojox.storage.PENDING; these values determine how the put request went. In some storage systems users can deny a storage request, resulting in a dojox.storage.FAILED, while in other storage systems a storage request must wait for user approval, resulting in a dojox.storage.PENDING status until the request is either approved or denied, resulting in another call back with dojox.storage.SUCCESS. The second argument in the call back is the key name that was being stored. The third argument in the call back is an optional message that details possible error messages that might have occurred during the storage process.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.description: Optional string namespace that this value will be placed into; if left off, the value will be placed into dojox.storage.DEFAULT_NAMESPACE

method.name: getMultiple
method.description: Object Gets the valuse corresponding to each of the given keys. Returns a null array element for each given key that is not in the storage system.

parameter.name: keys
parameter.description: An array of string keys to get the value of.

parameter.name: namespace

method.name: removeMultiple
method.description: Removes the given keys from this storage system.

method.name: hasSettingsUI
method.description: Boolean Determines whether this provider has a settings UI.

method.name: showSettingsUI
method.description: If this provider has a settings UI, determined by calling hasSettingsUI(), it is shown.

method.name: hideSettingsUI
method.description: If this provider has a settings UI, hides it.

method.name: isValidKey
method.description: Boolean Subclasses can call this to ensure that the key given is valid in a consistent way across different storage providers. We use the lowest common denominator for key values allowed: only letters, numbers, and underscores are allowed. No spaces.

method.name: getResourceList
method.description: Array[] Returns a list of URLs that this storage provider might depend on.

object.description: Storage provider that uses WHAT Working Group features in Firefox 2 to achieve permanent storage.
A singleton class in charge of the dojox.storage system

method.name: initialize
method.description: Initializes the storage system and autodetects the best storage provider we can provide on this platform

method.name: register
method.description: Registers the existence of a new storage provider; used by subclasses to inform the manager of their existence. The storage manager will select storage providers based on their ordering, so the order in which you call this method matters.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The full class name of this provider, such as "dojox.storage.FlashStorageProvider".

parameter.name: instance
parameter.description: An instance of this provider, which we will use to call isAvailable() on. keep list of providers as a list so that we can know what order storage providers are preferred; also, store the providers hashed by name in case someone wants to get a provider that uses a particular storage backend

method.name: setProvider
method.description: Instructs the storageManager to use the given storage class for all storage requests.

method.name: autodetect
isAvailable
method.description: Boolean Returns whether any storage options are available.

method.name: addOnLoad
method.description: void Adds an onload listener to know when Dojo Offline can be used.

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: A function to call when Dojo Offline is ready to go

method.name: removeOnLoad
method.description: void Removes the given onLoad listener

method.name: isInitialized
method.description: Boolean Returns whether the storage system is initialized and ready to be used.

method.name: supportsProvider
method.description: Boolean Determines if this platform supports the given storage provider.

method.name: getProvider
method.description: Object Gets the current provider

method.name: loaded
method.description: The storage provider should call this method when it is loaded and ready to be used. Clients who will use the provider will connect to this method to know when they can use the storage system. You can either use dojo.connect to connect to this function, or can use dojox.storage.manager.addOnLoad() to add a listener that does not depend on the dojo.event package.

method.name: getResourceList
method.description: Returns a list of whatever resources are necessary for storage providers to work.

object.description: The storage provider that was automagically chosen to do storage on this platform, such as dojox.storage.FlashStorageProvider.

method.name: attachInput

parameter.name: pattern

method.name: createDisplayString

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.description: Complex Expression Pattern type. One of "FILE_PATH", "URL", "EMAIL", "XPATH"

method.description: This function strips the unicode directional controls when the text copied to the Clipboard

object.description: A collection of various objects for advanced string manipulation, including a Builder and a tokenizer.

method.name: tokenize
